Rce0jYcURVf45hZlLlED8g.text: Do the drink courses! Staff and atmosphere are superb. I only sit at the bar so I can watch the bartender masters create the awesomeness that are their drinks. Food was superb but I go there for the drinks and atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The wall of rum with a master tender at work.

isQPE6wGzl3N7Uujy-OcGw.text: Great cocktails, but the atmosphere is very condescending and unpleasant. I brought a group of about 10 people for a happy hour, and as people trickled in, we were repeatedly asked if we had a larger group coming. When the full party had arrived, we were asked to sit in the back patio, i.e. smoking section (which was not a nice thing to do to my non-smoking friends), where there was no seating for groups larger than 5. I want to be clear: none of us had had anything to drink before our arrival. We were not belligerent, we were not rude. We were just treated that way.  We were also given conflicting messages about substituting different varieties of rum in the cocktails and were charged absurdly for the privilege of doing so... until we were told it was impossible because we would single-handedly ruin the owner's entire brand.  All in all, it's a good place to go for a cocktail. They're tasty, but it was easier and more pleasant to do business elsewhere. I haven't gone back, and I have no intention of doing so.

7rOu2aCsPZ36utTXgBQ9tg.text: Meh.   Overpriced, psuedo urban hoity toity experience.   Should you come here at least once and try some house cocktails for $10 each? Sure, why not.   But is this a place to frequent? Not at all, well except phonys. Phonys will love this place. Holden, however would hate it.

cgFORdz4PPVTyVdfXm0FMA.text: Phoenix needs more restaurants in downtown and preferably more like The Breadfruit.   The food was innovative and fresh and the staff was helpful and gracious. Our first course was the Jerk Scallops and they were delicious. For my main course I had the chicken in a dark Caribbean sauce and it was amazing. My friend had the mussels and he loved them.   Now lets talk about the drinks. Actually, just have some and talk later. I would suggest asking your waiter or waitress for a full review. They will not steer you wrong.   The next time I'm in Phoenix, I will visit the Breadfruit. Perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ICn784nePaI4Q4zmknh0qA.text: Usually when you make reservations you expect to get in quicker, but when we arrived, 2 of our party of 5, were delayed in traffic.  Imagine our surprise & consternation when we were told we would NOT be seated until everyone was there.  The 3 of us could have been ordering drinks & enjoying appetizers.  Oh well.  While waiting outside I observed quite a few people similarly waiting and many empty tables, which didn't make sense to me.  So, first off, plan on being a tad irritated by the time you get to your table. (this would SEEM to be a major problem, but in spite of all the reviews complaining of this bottleneck problem, it continues)  I liked my meal, but in my defense I must say I have never had Jamaican cuisine before.  Still, I enjoyed it.  Everyone at our table was happy with their food, but it was a bit pricey and it was VERY noisy at our table. Conversation was almost impossible.  I don't know how that would work with that "intimate" scenario they are trying to create.  Our waiter was excellent, but he failed to mention the automatic 20% gratuity added to all bills for parties of 5 or more.  Seems like he should have, of course that might have cut back on his evenings "haul".  All in all, it was not such a relaxing evening.  When I think of Jamaica, I sure don't think of rigid rules and an unbending attitude toward life's little bumps, and the phrase "Don't worry, be happy" never came to mind.

5k7D3O6wSkaZau4gMv38gA.text: Cute little place tucked away on a side street in downtown Phx.  If you like Rum, then this is your place! And if you don't like rum, you might be persuaded! I can't remember the number of different kinds of rum they have over 100 for sure.... The Rum Punch was delicious, smoky but fruity. They had another drink made with rum and cream soda I really enjoyed as well!! They have a cigar lounge and the patio is nice to enjoy your rum and a nice cigar, if you are into that sort of thing. The restaurant as a whole has a great vibe and ambiance. Everyone, from bartenders to hostess to wait staff were all very friendly and helpful when choosing drinks and food.  If you like Jamaican food. That is the specialty. I'm not a huge fan. The food was good, but I just didn't find it to be off the charts fantastic. I had the Curried Goat, tasted good, but the goat was fatty and chewy. My husband had the pork belly... (big ol hunks of "bacon" essentially)... the first hunk was pure fat, no meat at all. The other slices had a good combo of fat and meat, but he was also not entirely impressed. Our other friends got the Jerk Chicken, which looked really good. Overall, the drinks are strong and delicious, but the food was overpriced and just OK. I would definitely come back for drinks though!!

tu9Qu-hZEz6KWr1fP9kpQg.text: Give this place an A+ went in for the first time great atmosphere ! Smells of glorious food in there but what made me write this was the service i got at the bar from Mitch Lyons. He asked what i normally drink and what i expected from a drink so i told him he replied with a simple "i got you" came back with a piece of art ! Hand crafted beautifully presented drink for the first one didnt think he could top it but made me a second that was even better than the first ! Hands down their best cocktail maker !

c4wYoc2pQINxkGnehyt9pg.text: There's an authentic Jamaican restaurant in Phoenix.  Yes, you can re-read what I wrote--there IS an authentic Jamaican restaurant in Phoenix.  We had the Jamaican Jerk Chicken and it was soooo spicy--which was exactly what we wanted.  The place is small, but it's quaint that way.  I love when they have music and I heard the Rum Bar is amazing.  I haven't been since that opened but I will now that I read the other reviews.  A rum drink and a spicy Jamaican Jerk chicken sounds divine. In Phoenix no less! Make reservations for weekends.

JgI3X-QgVntuDY7dIrY2LA.text: So delicious!!! We had the jerk chicken and the shrimp salad. It was delightful. The drinks are amazing too. Great atmosphere.

k6wc16V7uf7ktnOmAM3g1A.text: This place is so wonderful for cocktailsssss, it's so dangerously good. My favorite place to go in Phx for tasty beverages but it's expensive so I gotta watchale. The owner is lightweight a jerk though. I always sit at the bar and drink and never have been inside to eat. The drink menu changes w/solstice and thy are so yummy! This time I got the Bourbon Masquerade so sarsaparillayyy & cherrish and I luv it. My homegirl had the Tongue & Groove, oh my goodness, shut it down or turn It up, "whatever blows ur hair back" type of good. She did say though she probly wouldn't get another cuz the balsamic sits in ur stomach. We also got  a yummy app some smoked marlin dish. Totally not what you imagine but none the less tasty however last time we got the salted mackerel app and that is way better. Either way hands down numero uno spot on my place for beverages

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. smoking the glass for the shorty

4ufBZ6lx8dDVwBmxzeG5CQ.text: This is a hidden treasure. An extremely romantic and soothing environment with delicious rum remedies! Candles really set the scene for an intimate outing. It's so warm and welcoming that you would think you were right at home. The food is nothing less than amazing. It's surprising that they offer this caliber of beautiful and delicious meals for such a great price. The waitress we had was very informative and suggested perfect items to try and ultimately fall in love with. I would highly suggest going!

72ARjltah2hmZTaWJR_YNw.text: Each time I've been here the food has been lick the plate of every drop amazing. The cocktails are also great! The service can be slow, but I haven't found the service to be bad. I'm headed there again this week. I wish there was a touch more elbow room in the restaurant, but that's about it!

8pGZycx4NKC96BvkKCdp0g.text: What great time on Saturday night. Loved the whole fried red snapper and pina coladas.  The drinks were tasty, the food was delicious, the restaurant is cool and charming.  Would go back in a heartbeat.

aiNPFaCbOHr1hUIFYZDcIg.text: This place is phenomenal - was in town for a work conference from NY and decided to give it a try.  I was in Phoenix a few months before and all of my food was terrible so I was weary,  this place knocks it out of the park.  It was a little bit but spicy for me,  (could only eat half my jerk chicken because the run was so spicy), but it generally enhanced the flavors instead of decimated them.  Also I am NOT a rum drinker (don't like sweet and the sugarcane normally gives me a headache), but I had TWO cocktails here and they both were off the charts.  Be warned - the appetizer portions are small,  but it's fine for an appetizer - my jerk chicken and my colleague's salmon entree were plentiful.

cJMdblvoXwuoY55gfinWQw.text: We were in town for a conference and saw their ad at the convention center. So glad we decided to go. Owner was very polite as it was a Saturday night and we did not have a reservation. He gave us the last table outside and misters made it comfortable. Daily rum punch and mojitos were great. Salmon, short ribs and curry tofu were outstanding. Loved plaintain chocolate dessert. Service was attentive and informative. Unfortunately they were closed on Sundays or we would have gone again. Enjoy this gem Phoenix!

B80SapdJLZv3T4lIzwRvcw.text: Loved the beautifully curated drinks, the ambience was perfect and the pepper shrimp lived up to its promise of being super spicy!

lGS9bGQLCAwVGa_jQh7dsw.text: The food is delicious, and the atmosphere is good. That said, the portions are ridiculously small and overpriced. The wait time for seating, drinks, food, etc. is also longer than most restaurants.

_Psk2372wDT1j6UknRJl2g.text: Only had drinks. The drink menu was extensive and the drinks were delicious, service was very slow. Will likely return to try the food. Had the 54 fourty six.

IcbG5rDy1b0BIhb7nIKY2g.text: I can't really review the Rum Bar without reviewing Breadfruit.  They are really one in the same, and Breadfruit's food stole the day. But, to be honest, we have never physically be IN to Breadfruit.  We only go to the Rum Bar and we LOVE this place.  I have been there 3 times. Once when I was a sardine and packed into the place without room to even breathe, once with my parents in the comfy window seating are and once with my husband on a romantic date for 2.  I loved it every time...and by the third time, I was told by my husband "YOU HAVE TO YELP THIS PLACE NOW!" and he then exclaimed "I think this is my favorite food in the entire city."    My husband is not one to stake claim on anything less than spectacular (he is married to ME!)  so here I am giving them the highest rating and review I can muster...  The drinks are extremely tasty, unique, clever and strong. I love the rums and the free tastings we have had of the various types of rum.  This place has really opened my mind and expanded my knowledge. I like that the bartenders and staff always ask our names and take an interest in what we are eating, drinking, talking about and liking about life.  They are so kind!  But...and yes, there's a but...the Rum Bar experience won't be bringing us back.  It's the FOOD that is the big draw. What a great culinary experience. Every bite is a wonderful adventure. The spices, the mixture of fruits with the savory dishes, the fish...oh the fish!  We plan on going back again...and again!  The location is a little tricky to find, but if you found SENS/Turf, it's in the same block (nearly the same building), but just around the corner. Don't despair, just walk south and take a left (east) and you'll see Breadfruit on the left.

R-tAG6RIAIYjc6-rYYpHbw.text: Thoroughly enjoyed everything about this place.  The service was the best I've had in years - 5 star all the way.  the only reason I didn't give this place 5 star is because it's too small.   Food was amazing, and as I said our server Joni was fabulous!

M9zJEb-WOW38eKRqldi5wA.text: I stayed in Scottsdale for 5 weeks. Ate everywhere, drank at many different places.   Visited this place twice. I enjoyed a very excellent house punch the first time that had me waiting to return again.   Second time I came I had a tour of three very different drinks. There was actually a fourth but I didn't like it and the bartender graciously disposed of it and took it off my bill. She was genuinely hospitable and gave me no anxiety over it. I don't recall her name, I just know that she's from NM originally... her drinks were excellent. I really appreciated that she understood my preferred flavor profiles and considered that I wanted to enjoy multiple, contrasting drinks.  The owner tended the bar as well, a nice guy. I thought her drinks were very well-made, but I noticed that the owner was coaching her over, for example, drinks that were a couple ounces short. Just a note of their attention to detail at this place.  I don't agree with the person who called this place "hoity toity". He's probably satisfied with Phoenix's endless (but competent) beer and hamburger joints.   Since this is a review for Rum Bar, I think 5 stars is definitely appropriate. But to comment on the food-- I had two entrees, one of jerk chicken, another of.. a sort of fish. Probably escovitch. The rice a bit dry, jerk chicken dry, not flavorful enough. But the service was excellent and they seated us 10 minutes before their closing.

KKetqFgeF0kfVbzy0zbTyQ.text: The fedora wearing character at the door thought he was too cool for school.   None of the staff seemed genuine.  Food was nothing to "jerk" it over.  Get it? :-).     Anywhoooooo,  2 stars just because I could come back to smoke a cigar on the patio and the Rum selection is good as well.

RR_-A2vIoe1olS7QadaOeQ.text: I wish there were more stars to give.  This place is amazing.  The scallops are some of the best scallops I have had anywhere I just wish they would bring back the entree version.  The pork belly is to die for as well.  Now let us talk about the rums, with over a 100 to choose from you will not be let down.  Although rum is not normally my choice in spirits the dark and stormy here gets me every time.  The homemade ginger beer is delicious.  Even though we don't live in Phoenix anymore anytime we visit we make it to Breadfruit.  Definitely make a reservation as they are always busy.

nJRck6l3PEVxINR7fep3Cg.text: The food, cocktails, and service are fantastic. I would give it 5 stars but we also came here for the cigar lounge which was not very good to be honest. Its outside and there is very verrry little lighting. Nobody wants to sit in complete darkness. Very disappointing. Even so i would recommend for the food.

-ht_H7_lqzZbgWenErGD_A.text: This is one of the best, if not, the only place to try every rum from the Caribbean in the valley. They have highly skilled bartenders and a rotating cocktail menu. I'd recommend one of their classics, like a rum old fashion or dark and stormy. They also have more exotic drinks like a trade wind swizzle.   If the rum alone isn't enough to consider this spot as a, must try, the food is fantastic as well. I recommend the jerk chicken most of all.  Go in, say hello to Dwayne and enjoy yourself.

8yeUVAsHqgNVk1tIH1qqeA.text: Without question, the best drinks in town.  I never had an affinity for rum until I started visiting this place regularly.  Every drink has so much thought and artistry behind it.    Also, their coconut curry tofu is to DIE for.  I've been here more than 20 times and I've never had a bad experience.  I'll be in again soon for the fall menu!

JPEN1Ym6ZqzHTPuIVs3BXw.text: The place ambience is very relaxing.  The Jerk Chicken was not very spicy , the overall dish was very good.  The Punch bowl drink was a great addition

K67doaXiz3D_yvBn_liXPw.text: I highly recommend this place . The food is phenomenal and the drinks are absolutely amazing. The bartenders, Ryan and Eric are artist behind the bar and extremely knowledgeable about every aspect of their menu. Its definitely a paradise for every rum or seafood lover.  Thank you for the wonderful service. I will be back again !

9mvlDQEitPtMtdIFMqHNNw.text: Cute lil spot downtown phx. We sat on the patio the waiter was very good and knowledgeable abt every thing on the menu. Everything he suggested he sold us on. The cocktails were top notch! We shared apps. Spicy shrimp and plantains delicious. Jerk chicken was awesome. Only thing I wish they had were oxtails that woulda put this place at 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cocktails.
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jerk chicken was so tasty

isorOvkheIUoDOPbnjyYDQ.text: Honestly, I love the food and drink, but I'm beyond tired of the rude hostess and servers that I've encountered on several occasions

wqsc3YbvVWXHz7yq12rCVA.text: I would love to review this place, but we were never seated. I found this place online in a web search and decided to give it a try on Friday 3/22/19. My friend and I arrived around 8 pm and the atmosphere seemed quaint and low key. The restaurant wasn't busy and there were 4 people seated at the bar. We wait at the hostess stand and an employee asks us if we have reservations. We did not have reservations, but as I scanned the restaurant it was not crowded nor busy by anyone's definition. The employee asks us to take a seat and he will be with us. Another couple walks in and the scene repeats (they looked bewildered too because they did the cursory glance around the place and was also asked to wait). So we waited and continued to wait and reviewed the menu - which looked interesting, but not authentic. Eventually we left as we realized we were not going to be seated. As we are walking back to the car, I again look at the dining area (which can be seen through the windows on the front of the building) and it is not busy. So for wasting the time in my life that I can not get back, I give this place one star.

10FUcE2KbMVupgnPmKdTgg.text: This was a tough one to review. On one hand the food is really good however expensive for what it is. $260 for 4 people and drinks. The place is very loud and hard to hear the person next to you. The service was very in your face. Not relaxed like the Caribbean.  I still would recommend

JZqwcLAzQDXNeqi0RgKaIA.text: New Year's Eve only: very disappointed in this otherwise great restaurant.  When the cup of soup is the highlight of the 5 (very small) course $75 prix fixe meal, it's not saying much. My main course choice of almond crusted white fish of some sort was not crusted, but was instead a small square of mushy fish on mushy paste with no flavor (supposed to be curried). My friend's poached quail looked so tiny. The dessert (black rum cake) I chose was over-rummed and had the taste and texture of an unsweetened bean paste with cranberries and a few walnuts on the side. A friend chose the small chocolate tart and liked it. Special menus should be tested on someone with taste before being executed on the public. With cocktails that were lackluster, it was an unsatisfactory $123 meal.

oWIP2mavGb-l2d6IENBBtw.text: Delicious and romantic and would go back.  Went on a monday night, no problems.  Seated earlier than the reservation and ordered two small plates, two entrees and a dessert.  The scallops were tasty (you get two of them) and the coconut curried tofu was great. They were out of the whole fish options which were my first choices though.

LbzKSs5T29Ch7JkgCWy2QA.text: This was my first visit and being located in the heart of the arts district in downtown Phoenix was appealing! This small and quaint restaurant had great smells of the Caribbean cuisine! We were seated close to the rum bar area which was neat to watch the bartenders mixing an assortment of rum cocktails ! The punch rum had a light hint that was unsweet and the lime sugar rum was freshly squeezed lime with rum! Of course had to have the sweet plantains with mango dip. The main meal was some sort of a beef stew with yucca potatoes rolled into a ball. The stew sauce was unbelievably tasty. Ended the night with a cigar and 15 year aged rum!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rum and lime sugar cocktail
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brugal 1888 gran reserva rum pairing w Romeo y Julieta cigar

4O1_akGyuH7iHJCrU8JCyg.text: Amazing place, great food and drinks are unique. I've been here several times and it never gets old.

JQbV_z-vvve2gFu8aPWEGw.text: This place has great drinks and a good atmosphere. The service is good. Come early carribean food takes time to cook.

R17oGs1N9qv9d9SNmfClkg.text: My boyfriend and I went to the rum and cigar bar part of the establishment and Isaac was our server. He was amazing! Definitely should get a raise or praise from work. He told us all about the history of the establishment, how the drinks would taste, and how they paired with cigars. Really made my night to have such an attentive and sweet server.

-Z0D2CSNKUo21j7fFLwUkw.text: What a perfect evening. Delicious, thoughtfully sourced and prepared food, along with fresh, creative and very reasonably priced cocktails. Wonderful ambiance. Chef Danielle is a local treasure.

h6_KccH_9CTwdBNPUUFQqg.text: This place has authentic outstanding Jamaican cuisine. They go the extra mile to bring in pimento would to make there jerk authentic. And it shows!

sdWHLLSuwfN0BXmlyb7k2Q.text: We went on a Friday night without a reservation and had a less than 10 minute wait. It's a very nice and cute spot and the vibe is fun and eclectic! We got seated but ended up having to call another waiter to see where our waiter was...in the midst of good conversation we did not realize that no one had come to the table to get our drink order for 15 or so minutes.  Drinks were ordered and were absolutely amazing. My colleague liked her salmon dish and I ordered the jerk chicken - it was very good and flavorful, but the rice and beans turned it all off for me. The rice was super dry, which made the dish harder to eat. I've had better Jamaican food, so if you try Jerk Chicken here and aren't pleased - try it again somewhere else, perhaps more authentic.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jerk Chicken - good flavor and spicy, rice was a little on the dry side.

b15j9KJLNQERbhcVqRZVVw.text: Amazing!  had small plates very deceiving!! Taste of the islands on steroids!! Rum drinks interesting and creative!! Will be back!!!

CtZmQWVkN4jn9HYIUQ0SXg.text: The Breadfruit is a Caribbean themed restaurant in downtown phoenix that one of the members of our group recommended us to check out, since they had been here before...  It is a chill spot and very cool looking inside, they also have a cool back patio that you can hang out in as well.  I loved the look and feel of this place, but personally I am not a fan of super spicy hot tasting foods, so I only ate several of them scallops - the divers scallops themselves were cooked perfectly, but my mouth was literally en fuego!!! It seems like nearly all the food items here were hot/spicy, so this restaurant/lounge was just not a good fit for me.  I didn't try the jerk chicken, but the girls in the group complained it was dry, but a few of the guys seemed to enjoy it.  The staff here was awesome though ... Our server rocked the house and made sure we were well taken care of.  They do offer quite unique cocktails and they try to incorporate rum (spiced) into many of their drinks, so I tried a mojito to play it safe and it was good,  If you like spicy hot tasting Caribbean food/drinks this may be your spot!!!  Unfortunately, I do not, so I probably will not be back.  The food/drinks were reasonably priced because most of them cocktails and foods consisted of high quality ingredients.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YWXfPwkocbNV06wCwILfiw.text: The best cocktails in Phoenix. Great back patio to sit and sip an amazing drink.  The ingredients of each drink are very thought out. No fake sugary mixes are used. At times it  seems like and uppity crowd but that doesn't matter once you try a cocktail.  Sit back, chill and listen to some reggae. The Tamarind Ball and the Handcart are my favorite drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cocktails

wjQHz1ndfBnG3Zk4pjx7gg.text: Great food. The patio is perfect. Drinks are well made. I am not a big rum drinker but absolutely loved the drinks I tried. Loved the vibe.   I suggest the scallops and jerk chicken.

kP82xdbtU23cFFQHconZaw.text: i really really like this place...the seating area isnt that big,but has a friendly feel. The chutney that is accompanied with most of the meals is great. I tried the Jamaican beer and was a instant fan

PLqc-2ZKeDUAvJ1UYM_zlA.text: The first thing you need to do when you walk into RumBar and Breadfruit is to find Brian the bartender who, I think, is the best bartender in Phoenix.  The Shorty drink that they offer is, no doubt in my opinion, the best drink in Phoenix.  Brian is a master craftsman when it comes to truly craft made cocktails.   The food is always excellent and the scallops should not be missed. Small plates and entrees are exquisite yet spicy per the Jamaican cuisine.   RumBar and Breadfruit is, no doubt, one of my favorite places to enjoy both craft cocktails and excellent food!

PH8P14BK97bHZqfU2wO7hQ.text: I have been to the Breadfruit & Rum Bar a couple of times now. The first time was several weeks ago and I didn't have any expectations. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the food was outstanding, the staff was friendly and accommodating, and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. Fast forward a few weeks to visit number two. Unlike the first visit, my expectations were very high based on my previous experience. I was delighted when those expectations were not just met, but were exceeded. Thus far, everything I have tried on the menu has been excellent. The salmon is off-the-chart delicious and highly recommended. Also, do yourself a solid and save room for the sweet potato pie for desert. This has quickly become my favorite restaurant in Phoenix. Can't wait for my next visit.

MrsXnYsD7g8Sk9vIiHlrqw.text: Ugh! Waitress was not terribly flexible with food and drink orders. I asked for a mojito with less simple syrup and she said the mix is already made with syrup.  I asked the bartender separately and he said ok no problem.  I asked for the "modified" mojito.   She stated that the bartender misunderstood me???  It's a F&$@ing bar!!! Apparently the drink menu is fixed. No Mixology at this place...more like Fixedology!   If hungry, Do Not order the lamb chops ! The portion of two tiny chops was just silly.   Hopefully management reads this and makes changes.

97cy3TpgTYDnpedOpeZH4g.text: Was not impressed with happy hour. The only drink special was a $5 rum punch and half off beer and wine. There were only 2 beers. Other than that all the other cocktails were priced normally aka expensive. Also the staff was not friendly (besides our waiter who was very nice) and didn't bother to try and make us feel welcome. They also didn't bother to tell us bye or even acknowledge when we left. I will say it was nicely decorated and had a romantic ambiance. But I will not be coming back for happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The rum punch.

OHgSxb6hcJcNSkK7XrJtpA.text: Drinks on point.  Good fantastic.  Ambiance wonderful.  Service was excellent - can be a little to formal, but I holding them back.  Great spot.  Owners should be proud of their business. Will go back and tell others.

lzdjOy8v_yp-bsbFFpWPIQ.text: I popped in here after walking around downtown, and the smell was amazing.  I was already hungry walking in, but the smell practically had me foaming at the mouth.  I sat down & had a drink (non-alcoholic because it was a work day) in minutes, and my food arrived 15 minutes later.  The server was super friendly with lots of suggestions & tips.  She recommended a dish , and I had the fish specialty (escoviche?).  It was super!  I got the impression that the jerk chicken is very spicy, but with this dish the "eater" (me) can control the heat, since it's served with chiles and chile oil on the side.  I ended up going all in with the chiles.  Yum city!  I definitely want to go back and try some of the spicier food & have a cocktail as well.  It seemed like they have a small, but great selection of fresh juices and tasty rums to go well with the cuisine.  As a side note for anyone looking to go here.  It's in a great little spot of PHX, surrounded by other restaurants, and it is close to the light rail (for the lucky few who happen to live off that awesome 17-mile stretch of public transportation).  If you go, note that the place is tiny!!!  It seats maybe 20 people tops, but I think that quaintness adds to its charm.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut Water.  Doesn&#39;t get much fresher than this!
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This was their standard fish specialty.

rdrLC9AQrc2ZwJisDrJeYg.text: The Breadfruit, as it is now, makes me sad.  Sweet Pea and I were early Breadfruit adopters, back when there weren't dozens of great restaurants downtown, back when it was a tiny place with no liquor license where you could BYOB, sit with 10 or so other people, and watch one guy cook your dinner.  Breadfruit has changed a lot, and not for the better.  I suggested Breadfruit for dinner before an event because we hadn't been there in a year at least, and Sweet Pea loves the Jerk Chicken, and I love the Coconut Curried Tofu.  So we get there, and like 3 separate people asked us if we have a reservation.  It hadn't even occurred to me to make a reservation for 6pm, even on a Saturday night, but the place was full.  After they told us that it will either be an HOUR for a table, or we can sit at the bar, we decided to sit at the bar since our event started at 7:30pm, and I generally don't mind eating at the bar anyway.  Unfortunately we ended up with me sitting on the end by the service well so it was sub-optimal.  Also, when I picked up the drink menu, there was a dead moth underneath that I had to brush away.  The bartender poured us some waters and asked us if we've been there, and we said yes.  Then Sweet Pea ordered a Dark and Stormy, which is a very typical rum drink, this being a rum bar and all.  The bartender says "uh, we like to keep it on-menu...have you been here before?"  AWKWARD.  No, we were lying.  We explained that we had, but that it had been awhile, and then we felt like crap.  After all the "do you have reservations" inquiries and now this, we felt unwelcome and out of place.  Rearding the Dark and Stormy, ever since they opened Rum Bar, they've been all uppity about their rum drink menu.  I have been there and tried to order a rum and diet and been smacked down hard because G-d forbid they serve such a pollutant as DIET COKE with their beloved rum.  Whatever.  But a Dark and Stormy is a CLASSIC rum cocktail!  The best they could offer Sweet Pea "if he likes Dark and Stormys " was a mojito which is NOTHING like a dark and stormy!  He got it, and I tasted it, and honestly it may be the best mojito I've ever had.  But still.  I tried to order an iced tea, but they didn't have that either.  I considered sparkling water but noticed it listed on the beverage menu, like all the rums, with its country of origin (Mexico) and decided against it.    We ordered the Plantain Avocado Spring Rolls to split.  Then Sweet Pea tried to order the Jerk Chicken which has to be most peoples' main reason to go to a Jamaican restaurant, but they told him they don't have it, although it's on the menu.  What they did offer instead was a half chicken something or other, which is not on the menu, but is $5 more and doesn't even have jerk spice.  He decided to order the Jerk Pork and Polenta instead.    The Spring Rolls were pretty pedestrian (and small at 2 rolls split in half for $10), and it just made us miss the Patties they used to have.  They gave us a "palate cleanser" in between courses which was unnecessary but speaks to what this place now envisions itself as having become.  My tofu was the same as always- good, and Sweet Pea did really like his Jerk Pork, but we both miss the "old" Breadfruit, and with all of the restaurants that we now have downtown, we will most likely not be coming back.  It's a shame.

qwTxXvn6O6meDLLdbygIlA.text: I came here a few weeks ago for my birthday.  The servers were nice, the food was good, the rum punch was excellent!  The portions were a nice size.  We had: the Coconut Curried Tofu, Smoked Fish & Cabbage Canape, sorrel etc...  The rum menu is amazing, they use local produce/organic ingredients and I love the chic environment.  I must admit I wasn't too keen on the host up front; he was a bit abrasive to my guests (so you lost one star for that).  But overall, we had a good time in the outside patio and I would return to try some other things.

imT2dYPBhWPtVRDQwKLv4w.text: Never tried the food, so this is just for the bar part.  Rum Bar is a must in Phoenix. The owner is very knowledgable about his subject, and will share all kinds of stories about rum and its history in the US if you ask (protip: ask why he doesn't stock Bacardi).   The cockails are excellent and made with only the best. Yes, they are a little pricey, but I've never had a really good cocktail under $10, so the prices are reasonable, considering.  Just overall a great experience: good service, interesting conversation, and fantastic cocktails and rum list. As a bourbon gal, I never knew rum could taste this complex and interesting. A definite must-go.

vY_ulZYadHSOkiGW_QsM4Q.text: I have been regretting this review.  Why? Because I did my research, was looking forward to trying it, I read the reviews and I was comfortable that I knew what to expect. I went in on a whim on 4/1. I truly did enjoy my meal and experience, only to come home and within a few hours experience one of the worst cases of food poisoning I have had in years.   The wait staff is very good at garnering the up-sale, they were very friendly and professional. I went with the Escoviche Fish recommendation (blacked fish with coleslaw and a grilled pineapple slice) , the Mango Lemonade and the Sweet Potato Puddin' (almost $50 for just me, I felt it a bit over priced, even with out my food poisoning).  Like I mentioned earlier, everything was good and very flavorful.  I was content and full on the way home, I was feeling nothing more than a good meal. And initially prepared to give it at least 3 stars.   It is almost 4 days later and I am still not back to normal.   I don't plan on stopping in anytime soon.

HaFCyzSn8ZKDkQAtnrSdmQ.text: I thought this place was a bit of a let down. I really enjoyed the rum punch however.

RSDYv_d_8Vgff1rozdxnTQ.text: Rum Bar stands as one of the few places that transports you in terms of a cocktail lounge. I still have not found a place downtown that rivals the way in which Rum Bar focuses on its handcrafted cocktails and creating an atmosphere that is seductively easy to find yourself chatting with other patrons while also ruminating on your own thoughts.   I had really written off rum in terms of my imbibing repertoire because it often is done too saccharinely sweet and violently colored meant to get club drunk. Rum Bar wiped this away. The progression of drinks and their sophistication in terms of flavor profiles and what they do to showcase the sheer diversity and variety of rum is uncanny and intoxicating. The bartenders literally pull you into an experience that allows you to feel for a your short stint sipping that you might actually be shacked up in the Caribbean.  In order to indulge in this experience, it does demand that you spend more per cocktail but the quality is unparalleled that's why I suggest swinging by this place between 5-7pm to snag the happy hour. Remember the entire establishment creates intimacy and for that reason it easily gets filled fast and is better for not too large parties rolling through for the richness of rum. Reservations are key on busier nights and the small patio helps to only further the Caribbean vibe.  Also, not particularly a problem for me and actually a plus is the fact that for AZ it does have a dress code. Personally, if you think you can wear a ripped muscle tee to an elevated boozing establishment you might be a little ridiculous to begin with aka no post gym/ fake post gym active wear sporting. If you want a more casual atmosphere this would not be the choice for you. It is carefree inducing but not casual by any means and therefore, demands that you have to deal with some of the hangups and restrictions that come with this type of cocktail cruising.

Hrpjfm41nY50g-Rn_yAe5w.text: I haven't had many experiences in Jamaican dining but if this is what it always tastes like, then I think I'm adding Jamaican cuisine to my list of likes. Nestled on a side street in Downtown Phoenix, The Breadfruit could just as easily be nestled in a corner of a beach village just waiting for diners to experience an intimate meal. The vibe here is definitely like that of a beach town. Everything is calm, cool and collected. The dining room is tiny and if you plan on coming with more than just one person, I definitely suggest calling ahead. It's cozy, with dim lighting and perfect for a date night.   Moving on to the food, those who can't handle a kick of spice to their cuisine should be warned! The menu doesn't lie when it says that the food is spicy. But if you can handle a major kick, the food is worth it. To start, I tried the mussels. I'm not typically a mussel fan but these were an exception. They had a Jamaican kick to them and the servings were generous in size. For my meal, I had the Jerk shrimp and holy moly did they have a jerk of spice to them! The shrimp came with pineapple and this long piece of plantain type bread and I ordered a side of rice. The meal was delicious.   Now be warned, the pricing here isn't cheap, however I am not letting that take away from the fact that the food was delicious, the atmosphere was wonderful and the cocktails made of fresh fruit and delicious rum were supreme. I will definitely come back and this time I'll take a cab so I can continue my post dinner cocktailing at RumBar next door.

M9aak4vsBRcZVqRkuosPgg.text: I have been the the rum bar 2 times before and the service was fine as was the food. Stopped by tonight and was meeting a friend for drinks. I arrived early, they told me I had to sit in the waiting area until my party arrived. There was NO ONE IN THE PLACE. Yet I couldn't sit at a table and be served a drink? Or be ask to have a seat at the bar??? No I had to sit right by the door on a bench.  I went to Turf around the corner where they welcomed my drink order while I waited for my friend.   Way to pretentious for me...I won't be back

o6EPtv2h1hhPz1-00D9Y8Q.text: The host the night we went was extremely rude..basically said he couldn't accommodate our party when there were plenty of tables available. Therefore we left never to return.

YHGdpGQSyg6jt9ZdrgrvYA.text: Wow. I really hated this place.   Our server was also the bartender. (I ate there last night 1-30-12.) She was either terribly slow or terribly overworked. Either way-- not my problem. She came to the table and gave us a canned speech about "what she really likes on the menu." Of course, wow, everything she liked numbered amongst "most expensive" on the menu. Big surprise.   (If you read other reviews on Yelp, you can read about the pushy service. Just awful.)  She talked at us, and not to us. When we were done ordering, she-- in constant sales mode-- pushed the Rice & Peas, which is Jamaican rice and beans.   I love rice & peas, so even though I didn't like our pushy server, I ordered anyway. When the food arrived, my companion and I each took a bite of the rice and-- if I would have had a napkin-- I would have spit it out.   The flavor could only be described as "odd"-- and it was served room temperature. We both agreed- independently of one another-- that the rice was inedible.   Gosh, the way our server upsold us, you would think it would be at least edible.   I ordered the soup of the day. I was told it was red snapper with vegetable. It was a fish broth with vegetables. There was no red snapper. So why was "red snapper" included in the title of the soup? I have no idea.   So they basically boiled some fish heads, put some veggies in, and made $7.25 profit on a $7.50 soup. I was pissed.   Of course, I would have liked to tell our useless server / bartender about this, but she never stopped by to ask us how our meal was-- NOT ONCE.   When the food was dropped, we ordered another round of drinks and did not get them until our meal was almost finished.   The manager came and cleared our plates, so I told him. He just smiled and basically told me it was my fault for not enjoying the overpriced rice and soup.   Plaintains were oven-roasted and tasty. Very stingy portion though.  I would say about half a plaintain per order. These people have their food cost in control baby! Don't serve any food! That's the key.  The only thing that was good was my companion's jerk chicken. It was excellent, actually. As far as drinks go, the overpriced Mojito Vanilla was also good.   So here's the deal: If you are a hipster foodie who likes the idea of eating overpriced Jamaican food-- even though you and your knit cap has never even been to Jamaica-- with stingy portions, and poor service...this is your place.   They missed on every level. Horrible.

YamUYmaoXXVpRkcdmgw4qQ.text: I finally had the opportunity to check out this place along with some fellow yelpers this past Thursday. ( International Supper Club = Fun) The place is small and very quaint. Think of cute but kinda expensive date night.  Let me start off by saying that although the food was good, the price didn't quite match the portions.  I started off with the the pina colada as my drink of the night, which was shaken and not blended. VERY GOOD! I will say that the drinks are worth the price. It was $9 but it was good and strong so one was plenty. The mussels that were ordered for the table were quite good. It did have the smokey flavor and the broth that was left was good for dipping the bread in. Good eats.  I next ordered the oven roasted plantains for my appetizer, which were very good, however I received 6 slices and it cost  $5.00 or roughly $1.20 per slice. Plantains themselves before cooking  are a decent size however  the slices I received were just a normal small slice you would get at any restaurant that has them as an appetizer. I have had plantains at other places and received much more and the cost was much less.  For my main course, I ordered Scallops. You receive 4 average size scallops and a side of rice and peas. The scallops were good but I am not sure that they were $22 good. Maybe $16.50. They were nice and spicy and they did melt in your mouth but other than that, there was nothing extra special about them.   Some people ordered dessert and I knew that it was going to be bad. Not the dessert but the cost of the dessert and the portion they received didn't match one bit. $9.50 for the smallest piece of upside pineapple cake I have ever seen. $4.50 maybe but the fact that it cost more than our drinks, yowza. Although everyone seemed pretty pleased with their meals, they were a little surprised by how much everything cost in comparison to the portions. I am not asking for some huge over the top portion but still, this place is not frou-frou enough to charge what they charge.

WL8BRTJybsjPsE577WvXew.text: We all decided, on a whim at 9;00 pm on a Friday night to eat here because two members of our group recommended it with gusto. So, it's Friday night and we expected to walk straight in and find a table. Not exactly. We just hoped that we would be able to get fed sometime before midnight. We were very  fortunate only to have to wait for about 35 minutes. We were seated at an outside table. Perfect position as the weather was mild and the area is filled with interesting people. This restaurant focuses well on two things-rum cocktails and authentic Jamaican food. They have both down to an art. We were very fortunate to have a pair of waiters with style and a sense of humor. I know that many waiters can get a reputation for being a little standoffish, but our waiters seemed to actually enjoy what they were doing. They turned a very good meal into a memorable experience. So, why am I only giving this place four stars. I found two bones in my mackerel reduction. As this was a stew-like dish, I was not expecting any bones and I was very surprised when I pulled them out of my mouth expecting simply to find something vegetable-based that was a little tough. We were tempted with dessert and, even though the portions were small, the taste was enough to complement and complete the meal. This place definitely deserves another visit. (Review #200)

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut mackerel rundown with plantain and dumpling.
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breadfruit and night sky.

7kbX8_SfrE29mAtKQlVy9g.text: PROS: Authentic Jamaican cuisine with an organic twist. Food was very well seasoned. Waitress (Christian) was knowledgeable and funny. Drinks were visually stunning, strong and delicious. Rum is the ONLY liquor they offer but they have eclectic drink recipes that will please everyone in your party (I myself am a Bourbon and Vodka girl). Lots of buzz and great energy in the bar area.  CONS:  I made reservations a week in advance for a team dinner. I specifically chose this place for two out of four people in my party (one being myself) to have the curry goat, only to be told that the farmer they usually source ther goats from, was simply out of goats and therefore, they hadnt had goat on the menu for months. I informed our waitress that they should take this item off the website and menu. Furthermore, it is Business 101 to Only use one supplier. One of the persons in my party is Apache Indian and said they have tons of goats. Quite frankly we were both dumb-founded. I ordered a second dish to go... and was also told I was lucky because they don't allow TO GO orders because they cant guarantee the food quality once it leaves the establishment but they would "allow it" since I had already eaten there. To that I say again, "I'm dumbfounded." Guess you wont be able to order on UberEats, Post-mates, etc.

1gwRMkZMxIisUPGtXR3vzQ.text: Breadfruit is honestly one of my favorite spots in Phoenix. My fiance and I frequently come here. Whether it be to just enjoy a cocktail, or have a delicious meal and romantic date night. I highly recommend getting the scallops! They are always perfectly cooked and I've never been anywhere that serves a scallop dish that even comes close to what Breadfruit offers. Service is also always incredible!

tXiYC-AMPRpZapVsHQ0hDQ.text: It's a shame to go to a place that has great food and drinks that is spoiled by servers that have the personality of a donkey. This place just has a pretentious feel about it. If you're looking for a place that makes you feel welcomed and appreciated, don't go here. Great good and drinks along with snobby service! Cheers!

SAqt6Aif9bYai5RaV2OyXw.text: One word, RUM PUNCH. It is a flavor of the day type punch and all are amazing. Definitely make reservations because the location is tiny and I would recommend for more intimate parties. The food is so incredible and unique, I've never had something I don't enjoy here. Did I mention the outside is a cigar patio? So fun for the men!

SZzIe4q97LFHQDB00iX6pA.text: 3 years downtown and Breadfruit & Rum Bar is still my favorite restaurant downtown. The closest experience I can get to being back in NYC. Always fresh ingredients and locally sourced veggies.  The mood and environment can't be found anywhere else in Phoenix. The scallops are still my favorite appetizer. While the seasonal drink and entree menu keep the experience new.  But favorites are the Pork Belly, Red Stripe Shrimp, and Street Style Chicken are always consistent. The Yellow Tail catch of the day was phenomenal.  Relax, enjoy freshly made drinks, with edible condiments. Perhaps have a cigar in the courtyard (even with misters in 90 degree heat at night).  It's a tried and True downtown Phoenix experience.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Still in vacation mode with a piña colada

Trahr-44TIAtTXxZza7kuA.text: Came to Arizona for the super bowl this wknd coming from California. Breadfruit has been on my list for sometime.   Must say they fullfilled my expectations. Ambience is fantastic and the food was great. Savannah our server was awesome as well.  You can't go wrong with the jerk pork over polenta dish.  The smoked  marlin appetizer was tasty but portion is laughably small.    You cannot bring a bottle of wine from home here so expect to pay for some fancy drinks.  They specialize in rum drinks. The sweet potato desert was amazing. Kinda tasted like a cross between banana bread and a macaroon.    I am unaware of any Jamaican places in los Angeles so this place really stands out as unique.  Loved the Jamaican background music.   When you have great food ambience and service you have found the perfect place.  5 stars.   I would tell anyone in Arizona to try this place and cheebos for an awesome night out.

kXoxYrd8FSiSB1Wi5L5v0w.text: My all time favorite restaurant in Phoenix. NEVER A DULL MOMENT! The owners run a very tight ship which I respect. The staff is very keen on what it is they are serving. The kitchen produces mouthwatering dishes that excites with every bite and not to mention the cocktails SIGH! Kudos to the owners! You guys have a great thing going!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This needs no words, please stop in and be blown away!
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The BEST Pork Chop in Town hands down!
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No other place like the Breadfruit..

JVuw40bhNee5B0mA6HLCeg.text: Changing from one to three stars bcoz of great food and they accommodated us later, when we revisited them after an hour. But the reservation process is still horrible and they acknowledged it. Hope they will fix it. It's sad that they have great food and drinks, but the service is not great.

ABL2AQAtEukUSfYkEX_QRQ.text: Few places I've been to around the country catch my attention enough to warrant a review. Even more rare is a 5 star. Read the below 5 stars... they pretty say everything I wanted say. I run a very reputable bar and restaurant myself , and breadfruit is what I aspire to have someday. Simply put, its hands down the best place to eat and drink in Phoenix. You MUST sit at the bar though. In 5 years and tens of thousands of dollars spent on various meals and drinks at hundreds of places- THIS is my go-to, and favorite place.

uUoAxCb_igU6V_NspJta4A.text: This place is great! We went here as a part of my Brithday Bar Crawl! We showed up as a party of 7 with no notice on a Friday night and they got us seated pretty quickly, I do recommend though making a reservation or calling ahead if you plan on taking a larger party as it is a pretty small place. It was an unexpected stop on our tour though. The rum drinks are amazing! Our server was very knowledgeable and made great suggestions for everyone at the table who had questions. I had a Hemingway Daiquiri which is one of my favorites and it was excellent!

UpBigqapvNeLM2zxaedlFg.text: Island fusion fare...as in Caribbean. nice decor, very romantic and intimate. patio seating out front and a cigar bar out back....if you smoke cigars, and we don't. had no idea it was reservations strongly suggested but they accommodated us at the bar. all rum based cocktails, and the one I had was super tasty. they have quite the mixologists on hand. I had a fish dish. it was good. small portion for the price.  been wanting to try this place for some time, glad I did, but a little pricey for what we were expecting.

V1efIQkXaFg-_SYKJ369Ng.text: This was our first time to breadfruit. I was really impressed. The service was impeccable and the food excellent in an intimate but colorful space. A really nice date night!

rRcbz941mGabymsxKG7fkQ.text: Yummy joint , great fun, fun atmosphere. Cool vibe nothing to over the top but great place for drinks and/or dinner/apps.

TOB_Zd6EBW6UTWQSt6hU_Q.text: After years of visiting the Rum Bar for cocktails, we finally got the chance to try The Breadfruit for dinner. I was so impressed by the excellent service: my water glass was never empty, I was given a fresh set of silverware between courses, and all of my questions were promptly answered.  I got the Red Stripe Curry Prawns with rice and roasted vegetables. The spice was perfect - they are known for their jerk spice, after all!   My partner got the Jerk Pork and Polenta and said that the ratio between pork and polenta seemed a little off but was otherwise very tasty.

daCDz0vfVRHpxgwdwfvXTQ.text: Went here for my birthday dinner with my family. The star of the meal was definitely the drinks! The rum punch was perfection! Thank God I had the DELICIOUS hot buttered rum for dessert as the sweet potato pie was not my favorite. Service was stellar. The meal was slow paced which was nice for a relaxing night with the fam. Would probably return for more rum!!!

Ya_eHWDYGiWQxQar-akXaw.text: I've had mixed experiences at the Breadfruit & Rum Bar before, but this last one has pushed me to the "maybe come for drinks, but definitely not food" category.  The problem is the service and the speed at which the food comes out.  Now, I understand if the restaurant is busy that it may take the kitchen a little longer to get the orders out, but to wait 1.5 hours before ANY food hits the table is beyond ridiculous.  The waitress never kept us abreast as to what the hold up was, and we had to hunt her down in order to find out what happened to our order.  When we finally got to her, she went and checked with the kitchen and said it'd be 10 more minutes. More than 20 minutes later, the food came.  This situation could have easily been handled by a) letting us know that the kitchen was very backed up, and b) offering to bring us something to eat in the interim.  Neither of those things happened, so we were left twiddling our thumbs in hunger for waaaaay too long.  By the time the food finally arrived, everyone was a bit cranky, so the joy of the atmosphere had been spoiled.  It's really too bad because the food (once you actually get it) is actually quite good.  We had the guava pork belly, red curry shrimp, and jerk pork and all were quite delicious.  Same goes for the drinks.  If you're a rum fan, and particularly a Caribbean rum fan, then you will absolutely love the cocktail menu.  They even serve a rum punch of the day, which the bartenders change daily, so that is always fun.  I wish we had had a better service experience at the Breadfruit, but alas it was not to be had, and without a beach view to distract me from the unnecessarily long wait for food, this has pushed me overboard and is probably the final time we visit the island food at the Rum Bar.

CDSEdskH6iwtTAYoseHBpQ.text: Came for cigars/drinks on the back patio. Service was top notch, and by God were the mixed drinks tasty. Not your traditional mixed drinks, either. Was very impressed with what I ordered (shim sham). Would come back for a nightcap again.  Side note: the host was a little odd, noticed that mentioned in a few reviews. He had us sit and wait to be taken back to an empty patio? Oh well, minor inconvenience.

GZoLEOinJfBgqHYVELviKQ.text: Super small. Very intimate. Worth at *least* one visit. Also, home of the tiniest bathroom sink ever.  We went here for a friends birthday a few weekends ago. A reservation is highly recommended since they are so tiny. Our waitress recommended we try Rum Bars house made punch (yum).   Now, Ive never had Jamaican food before, but Im now, officially, a fan. As a table we shared the best mussels Ive had since diving for them ourselves in New England as a kid. For the main course, I had the jerk prawns, holy spicy Batman! So good. My husband is notoriously picky about his food, but he rather enjoyed the molasses fried lollipops he got. Overall, everyone was very pleased w/ their food choices.  Our waitress was very attentive and knowledgeable, and the atmosphere was very unassuming, and chill.  If youre in the mood for something a little different, i recommend going here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

slT_sdtk_g_om2mQ46NENQ.text: I wish I could rate our server separately because she was amazing and deserves 5 stars. Drinks were fantastic, without a doubt, however, the entire experience was disappointing. There seems to be an air of impatience and annoyance at customers coming from most of the staff, especially from a "gentleman" who I believe was managing. I am writing this review because I just can't believe how poor our overall experience was. Definitely won't be investing my time and money coming back to this place.

HH-PG_3guWjcgQvbpfNZAA.text: I wish I could come here for the cocktails weekly. They have a mixed punch that changes daily. The bartenders are dressed old school in a black vest with a white shirt. The bar has fresh herbs and homemade tinctures for their drinks. My boyfriend and I went here and had two drinks each. The bartender was very helpful in helping us decide which ones to try. However, I heard their drink menu has changed recently. If I am in the arts district again then I will def go to this place. The only downfall is that everything is so yummy that your bills adds up before you know it.

emveN4KHrJ4HJclR0iaJVw.text: The jerk chicken never disappoints, but the service/kitchen is kind of slow. Also tried the curry coconut tofu dish, flavor was good but the tofu was a strange texture. A friend ordered the pork belly and unfortunately they were out, so she had the jerk pork and was pleased as well. Each time I have been there they have been out of at least one dish, which is unfortunate. Despite the service and them running out of certain dishes I will continue to patronize the place because I think the food is really good.

Ii3QCZXaKXp-78nCL7gobg.text: Food and service is great. I love their drinks and the ambience. It is overall very pricey and sometimes a little overpriced. I only go there when I have $50 to spend in one sitting.

j7BolQFABVsguY-1e08jPQ.text: I have no idea why it took me so long to get to this place!! Such a chill vibe with funky music to talk with a friend or significant other to for hours.  After eating at Sens around the corner (which is FAB BTW) my boyfriend took me to Rum Bar, as he'd been raving about their drinks for quite some time. The bar is separated from the restaurant by a small wall but both are quaint and cozy.  The drink list hosted many unique offerings. We ordered a vanilla mojito and then our favorite, a Dark & Stormy (ginger beer with Gosling's rum). Oh my God....the best mojito I have ever had. A little on the sweet side but such a unique flavor with quality vanilla extract in it. I can't wait to come back and try the food!

ixUTQ_bM9GI50RMOmypVJw.text: The Breadfruit has a great decor and location and is a perfect spot for tasty cocktails but if you are looking for dinner, the Breadfrult is a disappointment. As others have noted there is no host of any kind so even with a reservation you stand around awkwardly waiting to be seated by someone. The food has good spice but I found dishes way too sweet and portions are astoundingly tiny on the whole. The jerk chicken was the exception, tasty and well proportioned with tasty beans and rice. I hope they work on the hosting and tweak the menu a bit because the decor is lovely and you can tell the place is a labor of love.

uQwttEUQ5kmBv8PxmbWzaA.text: If I could review the drinks separately from the food, I would give the Rum Bar 5 stars!  The drinks, and the myriad of rum choices are AWESOME!  I think they have something like 90 varieties of rum.  YUM!  Plus, I love me some island-like drinks!  However, seeing that I can't review one without the other, I have to give Rum Bar only 3 stars due to the food, which is *bleh* at best.    I should probably add my disclaimer now:  I am from the Bronx, NY, and have been eating authentic Jamaican food my entire life, so my expectations may be a bit higher than someone whose never really had the real deal.  Now that that's done, on to my review.  I tried the Breadfruit when it first opened up a few years ago, and wasn't impressed with the food then.  Their "beef patty" was this square shaped thing that was nothing like the True beef patties that I get from the Jamaican bakeries when I'm at home in the Bronx.  I can't even remember what else I had, which speaks to the "memorability" of this food.  Soooooo, fast forward to October 2011.  My girlfriend had a birthday gathering at the Rum Bar, which is how I ended up there.  I was mainly drinking, and only wanted a little something to have on my stomach (you True drinkers know what I mean!), so I just got an order of plantains, and even those were on the dry side, like they had been overcooked a bit.    I will definitely hit up the Rum Bar again for the cocktails, but I'll make I sure I eat before I go!

8YblpJNBAFvfCIlxiMIm6g.text: Such a regret. The host treated us as were an unconvinced to this restaurant. Negative behavior from all the staff and restrictions all the way. My friends (group of 3) walked to the bar, and asked for a drink the host moved us to the patio because we didn't had a reservation. We were the only ones at the patio and it took 20 min for a waitress  to come out and take our order.

8HnLv7JdLAu8986yEqIcrA.text: Sat in the new bar and had me some rum Flight and vanilla mojito was mighty yum, yum! As it raged down my throat and warmed my tum, tum Made my body go numb, pervert hands now rubbing  my baby's booty bum...  Ordered the appletin rum, sea scallops next  Definitely THE BEST, in the Southwest! With a spicy kick of zest! The crispy mango fish rolls, which were only so-so Still craving dem scallops-give me some mo! Give me some mo!  Curry chicken with dumplings was my main meal Texture is dense if you like that type of appeal Comfort that'll make ya re-invent the wigga-wigga-wheel And kick off your hood rat heels!  Boyfriend ordered the jerk chicken off da grill Finger-licking the last of his meal Damn, can I get a bite or do I have to steal? Prices, not too bad of a deal This rum has got me coping a feel!  Leaving room for some dessert  The Blue Mountain Coffee has got me on full alert Man looking so good, got a girl doing the slurp, slurp He's trying not to get hurt, As he reaches for the sweet Love'n, potato pudd'n  Overall, Breadfruit was the bomb Felt like I was in Jamaica, passing that bong :)

121bP3Xlh4wsfCa_UjLIWg.text: Impeccable Service, Authentic Food!  I was SOOOOO looking forward to a REAL MOJITO, but, sadly,  there's a serious Lime shortage! Next time,  & there WILL be a next time,  I'll stop by Sprouts &  bring my own Limes!

Ns8-yTJAyUeC8m7okGeByg.text: Excellent. New in town for business and was tired of Mexican food. Being Caribbean myself this was nice to introduce to my friend who is hear on business as well. Those scallops were life all in itself. Rum was perfect. Excellent service from Javier, the host and everyone else.  Thank you again. I will be back and I have already recommended that place to other colleagues. Thank you Javier.

D_6JTtZ8SRfyNpmmyu3H3A.text: Felt so bad, walked into this place with a huge group right when they were doing last call. But what did they do? The staff made it happen! The waitress treated us wonderfully and immedietly told us the specials. I'm not a huge rum person at all, but the signature drink she offered me was delicious! The astmosphere was great, very cute spot.    Rum bar is definitely worth checking out! I'm all about new hot spots in downtown Phoenix!

GD5LNDj7atyT2D2eDN7aBQ.text: The best restaurant in Phoenix/ One of the best restaurants in the country. The food, cocktails and ambiance is unparalleled. Do not miss

GpSfoZFhSfTC5qeoiKljAQ.text: I had a chance to check this place out before going out and about on First Friday in February and I was quite disappointed. The concept of the bar is awesome and the drinks sounded great, but the overall execution was terrible. Really, this rating is completely based on service and maybe I should give it 2 stars as their drinks are very good, but that's about it.  Upon arriving at Breadfruit/Rum Bar, we were told to sit anywhere in the bar area and someone would be around to serve us. There were about 20 or so people in the whole place (restaurant and bar), so it didn't seem that busy. However, it took about 10 minutes before someone came over to take our drink order or even acknowledge our group. Not a good sign.   After we made our order or Estate Mai Tai, Dark and Stormy, Mojito Ponganot and French Caribbean Breeze, two of which were the server/bar keepers suggestions, we waited and checked out the decor. The ambiance inside is dark and relaxed, but made reading the menu almost impossible. Others around us and our group were using cell phones to try and read the menu, it was so dark. I get trying to give a place a vibe, but can we get a little bit of light to read?   Drinks Arrive! These were amazing. I had very high expectations given the selection of rum and narrative behind everything we ordered, but was still impressed. Drinks were well blended and decently strong. The Mai Tai was off the charts and might have kicked my ass had I gotten another.  Which brings us to the next drink, that never happened. Our server/bar keep came by mid way through our cocktails and asked if we wanted a second order, but given the time it was taking us to get through the first one, three of us waited and one ordered a Red Stripe.  15 minutes pass and most of us are either done or close enough to order another, but no server. Drinks done and our group is waiting for another 10 minutes. No Red Stripe and no second order. What the hell. Now we are sitting around waiting just to see how long it takes, but after 10 more minutes, we give up and go to the bar to get our tab. 10 more minutes go by and we finally have our bill, but there is no breakdown of what we ordered. It's just part of good service to always bring a breakdown of the bill and we were curious to see if the Red Stripe we ordered and never got was on there.  Sure enough, after 10 more minutes of waiting to get a breakdown of the bill, there was the unicorn Red Stripe. Getting that off the bill was another 10 minutes and finally, we were allowed to leave.  I'm not sure what happened that evening, but there is no reason for poor service. The place was not that busy and they were clearly not understaffed  based on the amount of staff roaming around. The staff seemed preoccupied with assisting those sitting directly at the bar instead of the lounge seating behind the bar stools and the bar appeared to be getting great service. I'll give it another try for the drinks and sit at the bar, but it's with hesitation and low expectations of service.

DE16zUphdSas2K0yqc2d2g.text: I do love rum and should review the Rum Bar separately but both the Rum Bar and the Breadfruit restaurant are equally awesome!   Great recommendations from the waiter... Brown Stew Chicken and Jerk Chicken are really good... really spicy on the jerk chicken but thats somewhat expected and perfect for me! I'll take my plantains baked over fried any day! SO GOOD! Really great place to go for not so typical food!   The entire place is quite small in a perfect intimate way.  Their seems to be a lot of pride in the menu, environment and service, which is rare to see in restaurant employees. Not to mention a perfect location ... very walkable to other nearby bars and easy to make a whole night of downtown phoenix!

2fgkM3NOsFWaGJVARKw8yw.text: Awesome patio, and knowledgable service! Amazing rum selection as well! The food smelled amazing, and I will definitely be back for that in the near future Our bartender was very helpful in helping us pick out different rum-based cocktails, and she was spot on! I'm a whiskey man myself, so she suggested the rum old fashion; it was a bit sweeter obviously but excellent flavor overall. My wife ordered some concoction with rum and pureed kiwi which I could have seriously slurped down in a few gulps it was so good! The drinks are a bit pricey, and I think had they been a little less we would have stayed for another round, but other than that we will absolutely visit this bar again and again!

wGFm3ayzXz0RdkgNUCmXRQ.text: Great ambiance. Knowledgable servers. Not impressed by the menu selection. Curry goat was tasty. Curry chicken fell short. Drinks were a new experience. Very good tho.

ebFquZlRMPq8b6C0WBMaUg.text: So I've been back a few times since the first time I went, and felt it was only right to update my review since the last one wasn't terrible, but it did outline some issues in service that lowered my rating. Since then, it realllly seems like they've made large strides in the service area. A group of us went on First Friday last week with the Mardi Gras festivities the same night. They were slammed, and totally able to balance it all. Dramatic improvement guys, it's one of my new favorite spots to check out in downtown!

xNfe1sSrb2u1oUdy9RV3fw.text: We started at the bar with rum drinks with amazing flavors. The appetizers were complex and fantastic. What a great night. Great service too. The staff was well trained and efficient. For a restaurant in Phoenix, we felt like we were in NY or Chicago.

bnh4nk4ZDI60uYhjbvINRw.text: The breadfruit was amazing.  A little on the expensive side ($80 for dinner for 2, 2 drinks each, and an app) but it is worth every penny.  Service was great,  drinks were some of the best I have ever had, and jerk chicken was so tasty. We will be back!

X_m1J7Py_5NR3sBk_voyqw.text: Cute and cozy atmosphere and I like restaurants where the kitchen is exposed. The jerk chicken was very tender and I liked the coconut rice it came with.  I would definetly come back!

WKoZRdj5o6_h_OdplGr5QQ.text: Had lunch here.  Had the mango tea w/ mint, fried plantain appetizer, scallop appetizer and shrimp appetizer.  It was all very tasty.  The mango tea was excellent though.  The plantains were cooked perfectly with a little crisp on the edges and a little soft from grease in the middle.  The scallops (2) were huge and tasted like there were fresh, not frozen.  I didn't care for the shrimp and the peas.  They were ok, just didn't do it for me.  There were some banana bread sticks that were included also.  A little rubbery but the flavor was dead on.  I'd go back for dinner.

1seFNmOsPB3GAuhHmhdqHg.text: We arrived at 7pm on a Friday and asked to sit outside since it was a beautiful night and we would have had to wait a while for inside seating. Our server was friendly but a little pushy and managed (i know it's our fault) to up-sell everything. It's a BYOB place so we brought beer but couldn't drink it since we were outside. So we all ordered a fruit drink including a whole coconut for it's water then fruit.  The appetizers were really small for the price and although the mango avocado spring rolls sound delicious, they weren't that tasty. I ordered the coconut curry tofu which was great and not spicy (the jerk chicken was too spicy for me).  Our dinner for four came to $120 before tip - pretty pricy since we didn't have alcohol.

aoOWfPCyPaBYbvTGnlQlkw.text: Partner and I came here at 5:40 on a Thursday. I had their soup of the day, which happened to be a red snapper "bisque," and confused me greatly by being simply a seafood soup. A bisque, by definition, is creamy. Nevertheless, it came packed with spicy, fishy goodness, and whole peppercorns! I think the chef got lucky that I really enjoy peppercorns and fish broth. He came out later in the meal, asked if I enjoyed it, and said that he worried it would be too "fishy." Nice guy, btw.  Their scallop appetizer was well-cooked (nice jerk sear on the outside, almost gooey inside), but rather pricey (12.50). The jamaican spinach empanada was seasoned well and baked rather than fried, but wasn't anything to write home about.  The real highlight of the meal was the carrot juice and strawberry lemonade my partner and I ordered. Fresh and (mostly) local, which I appreciate.  If I could, I would give this review a 3.5 star rating. It wasn't quite 4, but I'll give it the benefit of the doubt because we need more environmentally aware eateries that give their food a personal touch.

IVHEBGATOMRnSm8jR1XuWA.text: The drinks are unique and tasty. The environment is warm and inviting. The food is very good. It is a great place for a date.

2Lvz_sG4YX88AoRAlKw5YQ.text: I went to lunch at The Breadfruit.  It was around 1:35pm  when my lunch date and I entered the tiny but warm restaurant.  We had the place to ourselves.  Our waitress was great.  Right away she explained the menu and sold us on a couple of mocktails.  I had the Carrot juice and my date had the Kiwi Pineapple Quencha.  The carrot juice had coconut milk, nutmeg, and vanilla mixed in.  It was tasty.  I love anything with coconut milk even carrot juice.  My guest's drink had kiwi and pineapple nectar and was garnished with a piece of sugar cane.  My guest gnawed on the sugar cane to give it a whirl.  She liked her drink too.  We split a House Tropical Salad to start.  The greens and veggies were very crisp and the fruit was juicy.  The ginger poppy seed vinaigrette was refreshing and I couldn't place the zing to the dressing.  I asked our waitress and she informed me it was the orange zest I was tasting.  Of course.  I ordered the Jerk Chicken and my guest ordered the Coconut Curried Tofu.  The chicken was wonderfully spiced.  The coleslaw was not wet.  Which I liked.  Much more healthier.  The roasted corn had a hint of something else.  Maybe coconut.  The corn just had a nice flavor.  I haven't enjoyed corn on the cob that much in a long time.  I saved the grilled pineapple for last and it was worth the wait.  My date's tofu was excellent.  It was like tender pieces of meat.  Again with the coconut.  She let me have a taste.  Yum.  I am glad I finally made it to The Breadfruit.  I knew it was there, just never got around to it.  I am glad I went.  I will be back and I will add it to my lunch rotation.

hAhSuyM_4XAkwdjsKRi-jw.text: In Phoenix for a few nights and checked this place out. Started with a drink that was recommended by the server, I believe the name of it had the word "punch" in it. Would definitely recommend it if you are looking for something that is not too sweet. Atmosphere is great for a "date night" but considering we had an infant with us, I would leave the kiddies at home (I know that may be common sense, but since we are out of towners, our little one had to come).  Tried the avocado and plantains appetizer which was very unique. Who would think to add these two items together?  Brilliant.  My husband tried the jerk pulled pork and if you like food with a kick, I would try something different and give this a try, as it will give you a kick!  Ended my meal with a butter drink of some sort, which was dessert in liquid form.  A creamy liqueur drink, but well work it.  Left off the sweet potato pudding dessert which also was unique and quite delicious.  All these items were recommended by the server, so A+ for the recommendations and listening to my likes in order to find the perfect matches from the menu.  Great date night restaurant and I would recommend sitting outside on a nice warm evening!

4FveVnCYcw-rMDw6QItvog.text: Mmmmm breadfruit.  Your jerk chicken plate is awesome.  A full plate to stimulate the palate.  Grilled pinapple for the smoky sweetness, cole slaw for the acid, jerk rub on the chicken for the spicy, juice chicken for the savory, a bread stick for the crispy and salty.  Really a fantastic dish.  My chicken wasn't dry at all.  I'll be back for dinner and will be bringing a bottle of wine with me as well.

8sp9ehC1dEzKp7iuDsWdRQ.text: This tiny place on an off-the-beat street Downtown surprised me.  I heard it described as a "hole in the wall" - nothing could be further.  It's delightfully clean and crisp, interior is tastefully decorated, very hip.  The food is fresh-fresh-fresh and delicious.   Fried plaintains, yum.   Tofu in a curry sauce, yowza!   Oh and this delightful iced - um - tea?  It was more like a clove tea perhaps, very spicy.   Had to alternate between sips of that, and water.    But overall: a very friendly, inviting place; service was lovely and attentive and everything was great.  The portions were large so I had leftovers for lunch the next day, too.  Note that there is an inexpensive corkage fee on beer or wine, so bring your own.   Oh and free corkages on Tuesdays!

apVT1vJjhRFvNcTiwDFtow.text: Really unique, sophisticated atmosphere. The restaurant serves spicy, Jamaican cuisine and lots of rum. We ordered an appetizer of calamari, but it was not the deep fried version, rather, it was just grilled squid with a fruity/floral sauce. The appetizer has won a few awards and we know why! Squid usually has a rubber-like texture, but the appetizer we had just melt in our mouths. It was definitely pricey for the amount you get, but worth the experience of fresh squid at its finest. I ordered the pulled pork over polenta. I wasn't a fan of how smokey the pork was, but the meat itself was very tender. There was way too much sauce poured over the polenta which made a weird texture, but would have been great with out it. My husband ordered a tropical fish dish which was excellent. I will definitely try this place again. Wasn't a fan of my dish, but look forward to trying something else on the menu!

P0rD2u8QiEhF3rsZMaNJ8A.text: My friend and I wanted to try something new that would be a change from the normal food-on-the-go meals we eat during the week. So we made the trek on into Phoenix, and surprisingly found the place on the first try. (Yes, the signs on the main street helped.) It is a cozy place (read "small"), but it has fun eclectic decorations and I loved the little lights along the window.   The waitress was very friendly, and we were soon set up sipping drinks.
