Be sure to try out the curry tofu, sorrell, and carrot juice.

FZDdikSM-UEd0L-cmo1QGw.text: Very tasty. Appealingly decorated and tiny. The jerk chicken was not overly spiced, but had a nice little unexpected kick to it. The Cocunut Curried Tofu was excellent.

o3SafLqbLT_zT2HyqHwvhg.text: As many times as ive been to the Breadfruit im surprise I haven't written a review for it yet. This is my favorite restaurant to go to. You can find me and my girlfriend there at least once a month as we both enjoy the place very much. I enjoy the look of the place alot. Its not big and fancy. Hell, you could easily pass right by it and not even notice its there. But that all adds to the charm of The Breadfruit and makes it seem like its a secret place that only you and whoever you are dining with knows about. Its also a romantic place for a date. The paintings on the wall are for sale. It can get a bit loud when it gets filled only because the place is small. But that's a minor gripe. When my girlfriend and I go she gets the brown stew chicken. I get either the curry chicken and dumplings or the jerk chicken, and I don't even like spicy food that much. But the jerk chicken is so good I love it. quote me on what im about to say. THE BREADFRUIT HAS SOME OF THE BEST AND STRONGEST DRINKS! I love their drinks there because they are never watered down. The first sip of your drink may seem pretty overwhelming. But don't worry, its just the alcohol telling your tastebuds to wake the hell up! The drinks are smooth and very tasty and you just taste a hint of alcohol in the drink even though they put alot in them. Which ive always thought was good when the alcohol doesn't overpower the taste of the drink. The Dark & Stormy regular or the Dark & Stormy 151 are my drink of choice, highly recommend either one of those. One more thing. Whatever you order make sure you get a side of festival bread. I don't care if your meal already comes with it, order a side anyway. Its very delicious bread. A dinner for a couple averages between $40-$60 if u just get dinner and a couple drinks. But if you just get dinner and no drinks, then its between $20-$30.

QDxtfayNSHtju_YosqHbzw.text: My first trip to Phoenix I was looking for the best food donwtown Phoenix had to offer. It is NOT The Breadfruit! Aside from their nice lounge-like interior it was awful. The menu is limited and its my personal pet peeve for someone to call a green plantain a sweet plantain. I'm a vegan so they have one vegetarian option on the menu which I wasn't interested in so I asked if I could create a plate. They said no because theyre flavors were expertly paired and the dishes were already made. Ha! I wondered is it a TV dinner because if not you should have no trouble putting rice and peas, plantains, and greens on a plate. I asked if a watermelon could be put in my mojito they said no like how hard is that. I looked around to see if the business reflected all the no's i was getting and the place was empty. Mind you it was dinner time and its a dinner restaurant. I finally ordered the avocado plantain spring rolls. The bartender brought me out to menu items that I did not order and tried to convince me that i ordered them The spring rolls could have been good if the plantains were actually sweet. I paid my bill and went over to the Westin restaurant and had a great meal

GBXHBglxZPtgW765cW3gvw.text: Yuuum.  It was my last night in Phoenix and I wanted to have a nice meal before flying out.  I ordered the Jerk Chicken and a few Vanilla Mojitos.  It was very well done and quite different than any other meal I've had.  I would love to go back and try the rest of their menu.

Lgph6RKbLD6Kxd4O3mq95g.text: i'm kinda surprised i am writing this. i know i wrote this review before but it says "write a review" so i'm going on memory. the food was great, we sat outside, table of 4, it was a beautiful day. i ordered the plantain spring rolls and the main dish escapes me. but it was fantastic. i was super happy with my food. i raved about it to friends. which leaves me perplexed why i am sitting here now 3 months later writing this review. lol. desert is amazing..so is the coffee. i'm not even sure why i have not been back since my last visit. :-/ i need to get my shit together.

j2pC34sQUHUYsk4Kzh3Agg.text: Significant Other and I went here back on Oct 15th. We had heard great things about this place from friends we trust, so we decided to check it out. As we were told, it is a very quaint place and could lead to wait times to be seated if you go during a busy time. Luckily we beat the crowd and were able to sit right away. The place has a dark, cool ambience, but looks clean and inviting.  I had the Sorrell drink, it was really good, but a bit too strong of a taste for me to go with my dinner. We had the Plantain Avocado Spring Rolls for an appetizer. They were good, but a little mushy and not quite as flavorful as I had expected. The Jerk Chicken Off the Grill was delicious. It was one of the most flavorful, juiciest, tender chicken dinners I've had. And the sides of corn, rice, and pineapple were perfect.  Of course I had to try a desert - the Pudd'n A La Mode. Very nice.  All in all, a great local small business to try out and you'll find that you will probably return.

3s-kQoSRlhoiPgkhe_CC6g.text: The drinks were great, the food was palatable, but the service was absolutely terrible, and I have never felt so unwelcome in a restaurant in my life.   I took 7 ladies here for my bachelorette party dinner (we wanted a low-key affair with good food and good drinks, and since I was going to Jamaica for my honeymoon, we figured this was the perfect place). We are all working professional women who are accustomed to fine dining and good service, but unfortunately, we got none of that at The Breadfruit.   Our waitress tried to push the most expensive thing on the menu multiple times, despite my friends saying they don't like seafood. She then tried to push everyone to order sides of rice and peas (I really wonder if they make a commission from selling rice and peas), and also suggested that my friend order some for her 1-year-old son. My friend went ahead and ordered it because she figured he could nibble on it if he wanted, and it wouldn't be a big waste of money if he didn't like it or wasn't hungry. More on this later...  Another friend asked the waitress if she could get her meal without anything banana-related on the plate, because she has a banana aversion. The waitress extremely rudely replied "The menu SAYS right THERE that no substitutions are allowed. And they AREN'T bananas - they're plantains." My friend stated that she couldn't eat either bananas or plantains, and that she wasn't asking for a substitution, but rather the omission of the plantains from the plate. The waitress stated that it could not be done, because it would ruin the presentation of the dish, so I just piped up and told my friend I would take her plantains off the plate.   Now back to the rice and peas. When the 1-year-old started eating it, he spilled some of it onto the table, and then wiped what he had spilled from the table onto the floor (he's a 1-year-old, after all! He hadn't made a peep the entire time we were there, nor did he ever try to get down from his adult-sized chair, so pushing some rice onto the floor was not a huge transgression). The waitress immediately came over and said, in the rudest voice ever, "Oh that's just GREAT. Can you just NOT let him do that???" to which my friend replied, "Don't you have a broom? I will clean it up." The waitress just rolled her eyes and disappeared (but never did bring a broom). My friends and I are generous tippers, and would have rewarded the waitress greatly for dealing with the aftermath of a toddler's dinner. However, after the rudeness we had experienced up to this point, we couldn't take it any longer. We asked the other waiter to speak to a manager, and after about 5 minutes (during which time our waitress never did reappear), the manager finally came over and spoke to us. He told us that the waiter would be serving us for the rest of our dinner, instead of the waitress, but he never did apologize for his employee's rude behavior.   I see from other Yelp reviews that others have had similar experiences with that waitress, and I question if she is still employed solely based on her scallop- and rice-and-pea- upselling abilities. It was clear she wanted to do as little work as possible and clear our table as quickly as possible.   If I had only gone for drinks, I would definitely go back again, but I don't think the food is good enough for me to want to tolerate the utterly crappy service, and I know can get good drinks so many other places. Sorry Breadfruit, but I will be getting my Jamaican-food fix elsewhere from now on!

yNtDWom9-MbrPD3DlRGQTQ.text: Upon reading some of these reviews I thought I had walked into the wrong place. It is an intimate, higher end dining establishment. Not an Applebee's or some drunk "woo girl" Scottsdale bar. It sounded like the person  who went before us was looking for the waiting service to come out and sing happy birthday.   I've been hard pressed to find anywhere else in Arizona with this combination of concept and execution. The wait staff was informative and insightful. The food is ALWAYS fresh and the menu is constantly evolving. I HIGHLY recommend the seared scallop appetizer to start the night. You won't regret it! The classic, Jerk Chicken Off the Bone is everything you're looking for in a Jamaican dish. The fresh cabbage slaw that accompanies the chicken provided the citrusy contrast that you need to elevate the spiciness of the dish. They coconut curry tofu is packed with island flavor and is great for the vegetarians out there. And for desert, get the sweet potato pie!

SBfsl8RDsgWrv2mMQ42Xow.text: My favorite place downtown to relax and grab a drink at the bar/lounge or enjoy a cigar on the patio. I recommend trying a few of their 150 varieties of rum or a cocktail such as the Mojito Jamaica or Jamaican Mule. The drinks can be pricey, however, at this place, you finally get what you pay for.  Try the For de Cana 18yr for a rum with the finish and nose you'd expect from a cognac.

NmnacVq7L8f19K2DLlRcWQ.text: What a disappointment!  Treatment awful.  Came all the way from Northern California.  Our Phoenix hosts were very excited to treat us to dinner at a Jamaican restaurant.  He left work, picked up his 5 year old and met his wife and us,  his out of town guests at the restaurant.  We were wondering if they would have food for the 5 year old who has some food allergies and would have understood if they did not.  What we did not understand was the treatment we got when we inquired. We were told the Chef does not adjust any recipes.  Okay fine.  But we weren't prepared when the help was joined by what appeared to be owner and/or manager who proceeded to say they are an "adult restaurant" and they seldom get kids in the restaurant in a very condescending manner.  I was shocked at the tone and could not believe it.  What about service?  What about a nice welcome, wish we could accommodate you but.  We were a party of 4 adults.  The Dad was willing to take his 5 year old and feed him elsewhere but the cold and callous way we were treated make that place not worthy of one star.  Just my opinion. Definitely don't take kids to their "adult" restaurant and don't ask for any deviation from the cooking of the menu.  Per the help,  the Chef will NOT make changes to his menu.

eyKzdGPFj69B2iQIkYQz6g.text: Hmmm....where do I start...SAVE YOUR MONEY!!!   Honestly, if you don't mind paying through the ear for a mediocre meal, then feel free and pay a visit, but don't say yelp reviewers didn't give you fair warning.   So I was taken here for my birthday, and I was super excited! I had heard good reviews and could not wait to get my hands on some stew chicken!!   We started out with the drink menu, the mango drink with mint is very good and reasonably priced compared to everything on the menu.   Since we heard the portions were small, we decided we would each get an app, share, and then each order entrees.   The Festival with mango chutney...taste was good, price was ridiculous!!!!!! They seriously make 2 tiny breadsticks, cut them in half and stick it in a small bowl of chutney. I don't care what fancy ingredients you use, but for $5.95, at least add some more breadsticks!!!   The plantain and avocado rolls were also small, the plantain was not even fully ripened, and the cost was $7.95..., these ingredients are not fancy, or expensive, and the flavor was disappointing.   I decided that I was going to get the the jamaican patty with fish, but after being slightly confused by the waitress I ended up ordering the chefs special appetizer...OMG what a MISTAKE!!!   The chef's special was fish springrolls with mango and spinach(or some other green) served with a spicy sauce...the flavor was bitter and it needed more fish...especially when I saw the price after the bill came..12.50!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! for the smallest spring rolls in the world, and the fish in it? Probably the scraps left over after they get the filets off the bone for an entree.   The stew chicken that I was soo excited about? ehhh...i've made better with a half ass recipe.   The only thing I found that was rare and delicious, was a boiled green banana that is hard to find in phoenix. Although a roasted sweet potato or yam would have fit in as well.   The curry chicken and dumpling is a joke! you get about 4- 5 small pieces of a cut chicken breast and a big dense dumpling, I was afraid to take too much when I asked if i could taste, so i took a sliver or chicken and a sliver of dumpling....not impressed.   The rice and plantain on the plate was ok, but again, the plantain was not fully ripened.   The best thing on my plate was grilled piece of cabbage and the boiled banana.   Now that I think of it, for a restaurant that is is focused on local ingredients and the experience of eating your food etc...why the heck would they serve mangoes, plantains, and green bananas and anything with fish for that matter...seems at odds with the philosophy   All in all, 3 diners, 0 repeat customers.   The space is nice, the service is friendly.   Food is ok, prices are ridiculous.  I would not recommend it to my friends.

ZRjpbGP3-CtJBJ-tb9Q4EQ.text: When we arrived to this mostly empty restaurant, there was a party of 4 and a party of 2 that were told to wait for their tables. We were told to wait as well, even though as you look around, the restaurant and front patio were 80% empty. We were told we could not sit on the empty front patio since it is reserved for dining guests only. That is fine but again, after we left we still saw a bunch of empty tables on the front patio. We saw the 2 person party finally get seated on the empty table after about 15 minutes. Same deal with us, as we were escorted on the tiny, completely empty, back patio lounge chairs. Our waiter was very good and was a relief to see good service after dealing with the pretentious host. When we asked about ordering appetizers now, we were told we were not allowed to eat on the back patio even though it was completely empty besides us. Too many rules, not customer friendly, almost feels like they are trying too hard to give the feel of an actual busy, highly sought after restaurant. Owners should reconsider the incompetent host and all of his silly games.

Q3VRhzIrw9JZP0uNlBQnbA.text: Came with a party of 3, cocktails where unbeatable and I felt fairly priced (our waitress was knowledgable as far as ingredients) I had plantain springs rolls and my friend had jerk chicken entree, very happy with both. Really a rum lovers heaven.

YJR0qJ09pva50r65EXz8DA.text: I am defnitley a fan and I've eaten there twice in the last few years. Most recently this past weekend No complaints at all about the taste of the food. Price bang for the buck ratio not so much  We had the fish rolls $10-12(today's catch spinach with a sauce I would have thought was jerk waitress said it wasn't and pickled mango.   We also ordered plantains $5and the jerk chicken dish.12-14. Everything was fresh and tasy. Portions are  much smaller than I would have expected. The plantains I think were five pieces totally. minimal seasoning and was expecting it to be more crispy.   Fish roll dipping sauce/ paste was so good. I asked for some more to have with my chicken. Waitress said no!!!. I was a little pissed. They say they make everything fresh and in small batches and she brought be out some mixture of onions peppercorns and habanero in vinegar!. wtf?   Grilled Jerk chicken was great small breast piece fresh seasoning similar to paste but more spicy grilled pineapple jicama and a corn n the cob.  Dessert with the local ice cream and sweet potatoe cake thing was also tasty.  I just glanced at Aileen B's review she ordered same stuff and said the same thing Maybe owners will read these consider some changes. Chicken breast can be had for 2-3 bucks a pound so a larger piece wouldnt kill them and the bananna cookin it a little more would make sense. Maybe add some kind of rub or spice. Desert was great as well We ordered mojito and I think the hurricane also tasy felt like Scottsdale prices but under 10 dollars for decent drinks. I wasnt impressed with the mojito like azcentral was that rated it best in phx. Next time maybe spend more time in rum bar next door and eat elsewhere to fill me up.

i7Mn0F5b4iisJfpkLM2mtg.text: Great Food. Great service. One of best places in Phoenix. I highly recommend the Jerk Chicken and the Pina Colada. This is not a cheap sugar filled drink, this is an authentic custom made, high quality, fresh ingredients and refreshing drink.

tjXvwrQoVhYwHbC_eLTnsQ.text: The Rum Bar was such a neat little bar down town, but if you don't like rum, this is not your place. They only serve red stripe or rum- but what a collection! I liked the vibe of the place. Very chill, and a nice patio as well. The servers were really personable and knowledgable. I was fascinated watching them make their drinks with all the tincture and exotic ingredients. Felt very sophisticated.

Kh9SDVbSbzN3PgHEkGuedQ.text: Wow, wow, wow.  My hubby and I have been wanting to come to Breadfruit for a while.  My hubby has been to Jamaica and all over the Caribbean kiteboarding so he loves the cuisine.  We decided to have early dinner since the sitter came earlier this Saturday.  We didn't have a reservation, but that was no problem since we usually like to sit at the bar and talk to the bartenders.  Tony and Beth were so nice and efficient.  Tony just moved from Portland in  November, so we had a nice conversation with him about the area (we spend summers in OR). I had a mojito, wow, the best mojito I have had in the Valley, probably ever.  My hubby had the Caipirinha.  It was so good.  We thought we would have one appetizer and leave.  So we ordered the Scallops, then the Plantain and Avocado Spring Rolls.  They were so delicious.  The scallops were spicy, it was like fireworks in my mouth, in a good way.  I loved the sweetness of the chutney for my spring rolls.  My hubby wanted the soup of the day, the pumpkin and sweet potato soup.  I ended up eating most of it.  Since I was DD, the hubby had another drink, this time the Kingston Rum Punch, wow, that was strong but tasty.  Tony recommended the Rum Glazed Prawns and Roti Flatbread, double wow.  My hubby had a Pina Colada to wash that down. That was the best PC I've had.  Not the blended coco lopez type.   For dessert we had their bread pudding.  This was the only thing I was not that crazy about, don't get me wrong, I still ate it.  I am just used to the New Orleans type of Bread pudding, more gooey.  The experience at  Rum Bar was so great we can't wait to come back and bring friends.

_K0tZBK2ovME6P5oLdIsQg.text: I went to the rum bar at breadfruit with my friend to visit her boyfriend and grab some drinks after first fridays, and  If you want a great nay amazing mojito come to this bar it is the best.    The prices are pretty moderate for the specialty drinks and food.  I ordered scallops for the appetizer, they were cooked to perfection and my friends wrapped plantains and avocado.  So good.    I will definitely go back to try there dinner meals.   Good for groups of 2 to 4 not good for anything larger.    Recommendation: to anyone wanting to go to a dark bar and a great rum drink.

dsOSczwrEDP8WKRZfw7OxQ.text: Too spicy, too not... I wish I could find a middle ground for it all.  All the rum in the world cannot the essence of Jamaican flare for food.  Eating in the bar is for the brave only, as you will be tossed and turned while eating.  Plan ahead on a weekend and make a reservation.

ZOa4tg3-8PmRsZfxMBJSbw.text: This place has potential (good ambience and location, adorable bathroom sink) but our waitress was rude/condescending and the drinks were over-priced.

h9NYRBu_vZZmZNzDE5KCJQ.text: There's no point in making a reservation at Breadfruit if they won't honor it.  Or to be more precise, they should be less deceptive about taking your reservation.  In our case, we were given the impression that we'd have to wait about 20 minutes for our little group.  On the phone they did tell us that there was another party ahead of us.  What they didn't tell us was that it would really be more like the 20 minutes times 3 for the four adults and two kiddos.  When we made our way in, the place was half full, but four two-tops were open and a large table for six was reserved.  Not for us, of course, and nobody was leaving anytime soon.  While we waited, a party of two walked in and was seated.  A few minutes later, another two-top near them turned over.  A little forward thinking would have been to seat the two at one of the other open tables, and put the other now free tables together.   It would have been a tight fit, but it could have worked.  Needless to say, The Breadfruit is small.  There is no waiting area and with the kiddos we weren't going to wait outside in the drizzle.  We waited in a hallway that lead to the bathroom until we couldn't wait anymore.  In the end we walked out.  One star for the cute ambiance but for nothing else.

2MePFNB-Jl8Y-ci5NDrvpg.text: X O Lent!  No! I don't mean the cognac! First off, food was great.  I don't know what "real" Jamaican food taste like or look like, but I gather it's similar to what I ate or hope it is :)  This is a small place so if you want to try it out go during the weekday like I did.  It's a BYOB restaurant so like your best friends NFL gathering bring what you want to drink - though unlike your friends gathering they'll charge you for what you bring, but the price is not bad...really!  Our server tonight was on top of it.  I give this place 2 thumbs up!

SgKuvb_ERiF85vFwYn4-DA.text: My wife and I went there several months ago before they opened the rum bar next door and brought our own wine.  Not sure if they offer BYOB anymore but the food was delicious and had a nice kick.  This is not a watered down version of jerk offerings.  If you like heat and a great relaxed atmosphere you will like breadfruit.  The jerk shrimp was quite good!  The lack of depth to the menu is the only down side.    Matt C

AzG7N62ib1la4J0nJr6dRA.text: love the ambiance  the small plate and entree selections we ate were very good, delicious sea bass with a lovely presentation, ceviche, plantain spring rolls. Loved the rum punch with ginger! The back patio is relaxing and lends itself to small group discussions. Unfortunately our waiter was a little awkward. He tended to come ask how wee were doing when we were clearly in a deep discussion. When he did so he tended to try to make small talk and attempt humor. By the time he understood we didn't need anything and walked away, we were hard pressed to pick up our conversation where we left off.  I still recommend this restaurant!!

-I5dkM7kix9eVsOAt0M08g.text: Came with a bunch of colleagues while we were in town for a conference. The food was delicious, but the portions ran a touch small. We ordered "family style" and had to order 7-8 dishes for 5 women. The drinks were amazing. The staff were a bit snooty, but otherwise helpful and timely.

RXRAfm8Cg3Acbr-4xZ7FCw.text: My girlfriend and I went last night and had a very good time. We started with the Plantain Avocado Spring Rolls which we both enjoyed.  She had the Curried Chicken and Dumpling and thought it was good but not great. The dumpling was very dense, a point that seemed a little odd, but the flavor was very good.  I had the Jerk Chicken off the Grill and thought it was fantastic; the spice was considerable but delicious. The other items on the plate complimented the chicken well.  We thought the portions were just right, and I feel the price of the Jerk Chicken off the Grill dish to be very reasonable considering the quality.  For drinks, she had the Rum Cider, another item she thought was good but not great. I had The Good Jake, which I thought was very good and packed a serious punch of ginger. I also had a Dark and Stormy, an enjoyable staple drink.  The dessert menu underwhelmed us (mostly because I wasn't in the mood for ice cream), so we skipped that course.  There was one very slight issue with a lack of attention when we sat down. After thoroughly examining the menu and choosing our drinks, our appetizer, and our entrees, we had still not even seen a waiter or even received glasses of water. I'm not an impatient person, so I think I was justified in feeling we had been overlooked. The first person I did see must've been the owner. I kind of assumed he was not our waiter, but I asked him if he was anyway. He apologized for our wait, took our drink and appetizer order just as our waiter showed up. As he relayed the order to the waiter, he stated that the first round of drinks was on the house. I thought that was a very nice gesture that made up for any mistake on their part. Based on what I saw of the service at other tables, I think this was simply a one-off mistake by our waiter and don't expect it would happen on a second visit.  Other than that, the service was very pleasant and attentive. The owner delivered our food and gave us some tips on how to best enjoy the dishes we had ordered. Water was refilled often. I was offered another drink as soon as my current drink was empty. All very good service points.  If I could give this place a 4.5/5, I would. The only mild detractions due to my girlfriend only considering her entree and drink to be good rather than great and the minor attentiveness issue when we were first seated.  We will definitely be back to The Breadfruit.

bkgYADIEfCAq5J-n9j4BdQ.text: My first time trying Jamaican food and might I say that I was not upset! I had the curry tofu and it was the perfect mix of spices, absolutely delicious. I was blown away with the depth of taste, very savory. For cocktail, I had Caipirinhas (off the menu) and again I was in awe. I'm not a fan of rum so I was not sure what to expect but the Caipirinhas was great. For deserter had buttered rum and rum cake, again was delicious. Must check out if visiting  PHX.

apzgItCMPVwo-Ewwy7DALQ.text: My go to place whenever I can spend a little money.  It is worth every penny.  I know i can order anything off the menu, even if it something I've never heard of, because it is going to be prepared flawlessly. There is no place that pays closer attention to the details.

z9fhdd8G8tO41iVrZLCz1Q.text: Rum Bar - great vibe, a touch higher class for those not familiar with rum. Rum connoisseurs step up and bring your "A" game.   Owner, Duane, is knowledgable and approachable to discuss rum history, science, and experience. Bartender Brian is accommodating and the music is on a cool vibe. No dancehall here!  All old school hits.   Salt fish fritters are good but small and rice & peas are good. No experience with dinner menu but heard food was good from patrons we spoke to.   Overall, cool spot.

UIp5i69Ay0whlRGuc7waqA.text: The best I've tried so far this week. I've eaten at five different restaurants prior. I'm out of town. Really nice service without being overwhelming. Responsive staff. I sat at the bar. The place is really cute and intimate. Ambiance is perfect. I came alone and enjoyed the experience so well. The bar tenders are artists and care about the drinks. I really like that. Food came at a great pace. Loved my soup and pork belly. Also had dark and stormy which was perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Belly, just delicious.
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Velvet &amp; Vinyl

NEpJ0qj60QTmuunkO5-jLg.text: I was visiting Phoenix for a conference and this was a particularly surprising and delicious find. Cocktails: I don't love rum but all the drinks have rum in them. We tried the run lunch (changes daily), fin & co, and a rum old fashion. All were amazing! Well balanced and smooth.  Food: we shared a pepper shrimp appetizer which had some heat but was really delicious and he shrimp were cooked perfectly. I got the red stripe curried prawns and my friend got the jerked chicken. Both were delicious as were the sides but I have to say the curried prawns were surprisingly great. The curry definitely tasted of red stripe but the mix of spices paired so well and I want to go back to Phoenix just for this! I sent several other friends to Breadfruit for dinner and they were equally impressed and raved about the food and drinks.  The service, atmosphere, cleanliness, and restrains were all great too. Our food came out hot, drinks were promptly delivered. It's a bit snug in the restaurant but that's really the only thing that isn't glowing that I have to say about it and to be honest I didn't even notice it that much because I was so impressed with the food and drinks. Highly recommend!

a1jZ6tGI2bRqTU-eEu3qhQ.text: Every meal should start with Grace.  And we did.  What a delightful server.  And what a delightful place.  Nice ambiance in and out.  And what an amazing array of rum.  The girls in our group enjoyed the Rum Punch of the day while the guys sipped on their Jamaican beer.  Our smoked marlin appetizer was a great start, tho the amount of toasted bread could have been increased (it could have been, if we paid extra?).  We all scarfed down our entrees, while my catch of the day was gone in no time, I was able to taste my husbands Red Stripe prawns which may be my next choice on our next trip...which there will be.

8rBkTCGLqngzeXcq-VyNoQ.text: My friends and I went to Breadfruit and Rum Bar on Friday night.  I was the last one to show up, but from what I was told, was the host wouldn't sit us because everyone wasn't present.  He even offered to sit them at a table sef for 4, but my friends said no cause I was coming.  When I arrived, he took us on the patio and sat us at a table for 6, which confused us because the table had been empty before my arrival.  After they told me about their experience with the host, I told them I had checked out previous reviews and seen a couple stating the host is rude.  We joked that hosts must come up with various ways to continue putting off customers for the sake of continuing the rude reputation.  Our waiter was nice, but didn't seem to enthusiastic (probably a long night).  All of us were having a good time and taking most everything with a grain of salt, but he just wouldn't perk up any.  He did bring us these tasty little mint leaves gelatin thing (I forgot what it was called) to cleanse our palate for the meal.  It was quite nice and refreshing. Our food was pretty good.  I ordered the tofu along with my friend.  She said hers was cold, but mine was warm.  Others got salad and chicken and enjoyed their meals, nothing that stands out too much.  I take that back, there was a slice of bell pepper, perfectly cooked...that little bit was simply amazing!  The ginger beer and Sorrel were both delicious.  If you decide to go, I definitely recommend both drinks. However if you do go, order your drinks early.  It took 10 minutes each for a bottle of red stripe and a pina colada. I gave this place two stars, because other than the drinks (when we got them) and bell pepper slice, nothing else was memorable.  Maybe I'll try it again eventually and see if we went on an off day.

h0Ii2nBjNi1pQkaBTfsBVA.text: Food was crazy good.  Service was very good too.  I like the aesthetics as well.  It is expensive so I wouldn't frequent it too much but I'm only in AZ for the week anyway.

ZyrnFJ5l9QD_2sXpkLUGfg.text: I have now gone back twice! Daryl is an excellent addition to restaurant entrepreneurs in the historic district of Phoenix, giving us more Rum' than anyone could possibly consume. His street chicken/jerk chicken is spot on. Not too spicy and edible by anyone's palate. My wife is not the biggest fan of Jamaican cuisine, but she still returns at my request. If only the staff paid a little more attention to the patrons. Each time we go we tend to wait for service on ordering throughout the evening. This wont stop us from returning though, the food is just too good.

8QNJRnGELnQws_Unol1OvQ.text: My GF says Take me out for a rum drink, I says your wish is my command.   Beautiful little restaurant opens at 5 downtown. A very kind sir welcomes us in. I see the rum punch and I order up. Now this rum punch is delicious but I would have liked it to be stronger, ya know 'Punch' $5. I decided to add a shot to our drinks with a Haitian five star rum.$8.   We also had an app of Cuban style pork tenderloin sandwiches using fried plantains. My Gf enjoyed them I just am not crazy for plantains. Anyway cozy seating and we had a good time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Ho

ju8uNmUiXmJsSCfNnWfowg.text: This is my favorite restaurant in the world. Everything is not only on point but excels at everything it tries.  1. Ambiance: gorgeous quiet lighting,dark and intimate. You can choose between sitting on the small patio or inside. A balance between quiet experience yet still fun and lively. 2. The drinks- Beats the Blues was a colossal success, balancing the earthiness of beat juice, spiciness of cinnamon and other spices and of course the rum. All the drinks are rum-based (and fabulous actually) including the punch of the day. 3. The food- caribbean, so lots of jerk and seafood-yet there are also vegetarian options.  4. The service- absolutely incredible. Every waitress/waiter I've had have always been so accommodating.  I look forward to the next time I get to go to Phoenix and eat here again!

rK_fYoeg0N3gVXo2fg6oVQ.text: The Breadfruit has delicious and had a wonderful atmosphere. I had the scallops which Gordon Ramsey says they are difficult to make,but you would never think that when you come here. They were slightly spicy, yet provided a delicate flavor. The jerk chicken salad was a little hot for my taste and lacked a little salt. With that being said, I loved the fresh fruit in the salad. I am a vodka drinker, but was eager to try their rum drinks... I am sure glad that I did! Our bartender was extremely knowledgable about the restaurant, their culture, and picked what is now my favorite cocktail: The Shim Sham. I absolutely recommend this place, just bring your wallet as the drinks are $9+ and the food is greater than $10.00. Know what spices your palate can handle.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shim sham: Appleton Estate V/X rum, almond, pineapple, lime, amaretto, nutmeg
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sugarfoot: crystal rum, grapefruit, lime, Jamaican sarsaparilla root

9rYsMwqwXaxdudxPnY7uDQ.text: Wow! I initially thought this place would be a super casual, run of the mill, Caribbean-inspired diner type restaurant but I was way wrong. After being greeted by an elegant gentleman I immediately noticed the cool red stripe pendant lights hanging over the bar (ripe with a fine selection of rums and other libation offerings). After finding this place on OpenTable for a New Years Eve dinner, again I wasn't anticipating or even necessarily wanting a "five star experience" but I'm pleased to say that's what we had. However the only reason this isn't a 5 star review is because I was a bit taken aback by the fact that their pre fixe menu wasn't advertised properly before I made the reservation, so we spent a great deal more than we anticipated to on one meal. Despite that, my beau and I enjoyed one of each from the options, and also opted-in for the cocktail pairings. Sure enough everything was absolutely amazing and my favorite dishes will probably the soup and the swordfish. I look forward to visiting this place on an average night and I'm grateful for the great service and delicious dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I have to look back at the menu to remember what this was exactly... Other than delicious!
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My silly mug showcasing &#34;the perfect bite&#34;, in this case paté, sprouts, some type of caramel brittle and edible flowers - yum!
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Swordfish and brussel sprouts, amazing!

2MIdSt_QtkFTCO3nqmIB6Q.text: Appetizers were great. Main dish was over priced and ordinary.  Would go back for appetizers & drinks. Don't stay for dinner.

W46tiLX2ZVOzV5oD3Z3fAw.text: This is review is not about the food. The food was great (small portions).  This review is about the server who sat our party. We had a birthday party last night and we had two extra people join us. She was very rude about have those two extra people (you would of thought we were not wanted). Does she know people Yelp?  She finally sat us outside, all split up. This was a Tuesday night at 7:30, no one was even in that tiny restaurant. The service was ok. They kept telling us there was a $1.00 charge for everything extra. I'm sorry but when you are paying $12 per cocktail and $27 for a piece of salmon, I think bread should be free......right Olive Garden?  Our bill came to $300, and I left still hungry.  This is also a RUM only bar. Who even likes rum that much?

rY2oRsraIdYEF3Q6Y32MKQ.text: Excellent jerk prawns.  The seasoning was perfect, and while they were spicy, they weren't so spicy I couldn't enjoy the meal.  The sides the prawns were served with were good as well (coleslaw, grilled corn, breadstick).  The beverages they offer here are wonderful as well.  While I was initially wary of getting carrot juice, the carrot juice they offer here is slightly sweet (from the addition of raw sugar), creamy, and the nutmeg they added gave it a very nice flavor.  The Pink Ting grapefruit soda is also quite tasty, as well as the refreshing apple cider (locally produced).    During our meal the waiters strongly suggested that we order the beans and rice with the jerk entrees.  I tasted some of the rice and beans from my husband's entree (brown stew chicken), which tasted OK, nothing special.  If it is so strongly suggested to add the beans and rice to the entree, why isn't it included automatically in the entree then?  Minus some points for naming your restaurant breadfruit, but not having breadfruit on the menu!  It's like calling your restaurant Kentucky Fried Chicken but not offering any chicken. : p

tMKEj097H06NCm0Tbps3XQ.text: The scallops and rum old fashioned are pretty bomb.   However, the service is a joke. Drinks take at least 20+ minutes and Scott S is rude. He has an attitude when you order, and when I handed him my drink with broken glass, he was upset that I didn't want to keep it.   Not a repeat place.

prIeDYoU7ShE0WM_2dOvqw.text: Came here with some friends for drinks the other night.  Every single cocktail we got was fantastic and we ordered 1 each from the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd course in that order. We had the Rum Punch, Apple 'onia, and Hot buttered rum. Lucas, our waiter, was very prompt and recommended some darn good drinks.  Now for the not-so-good.  And for this section I rename the place Upper Bread Crust Rum Lounge. Allow me to explain. Our group of 7 was very diverse and we found the gentleman, who showed us to our seats, to be very judgemental.  He accused one of us of smelling "funny" and almost did not let us in despite a reservation! We were allowed in and were seated in the back cigar lounge. My wife and I visit a local Phoenix restaurant every weekend and never have we experienced this kind of treatment. Finally, our seating location in the back also seemed to be the main travel path for the staff taking out trash and bringing in ingredients.  We felt like we were in their way as we socialized, interrupted several times with rude "Excuse me's".   We won't be going back simply due to judgemental and rude staff.

QdWkBVKZWka984Swj71M6Q.text: Very impressed by the level of service and food! Everything had such flavor and a little taste if Jamaica in every bite! Truly a must when you're in town.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Curried Prawns with Rice &amp; Peas and a side of plantains and roasted veggies

b-Afw1YcPEUgTM8TjkGjhw.text: Disappointed.  I was really looking forward to eating Jamaican food and had been craving it. My husband was excited to try jamaican food for the first time.  When I asked if I could have white rice instead of rice and peas, I was told the chef didn't alter the menu. What I ended up ordering was the nastiest thing ever. Some weird shredded beef.  The plaintains weren't even cooked all the way and were a bit raw.   My husband's food was just as bad. We were so pissed that we wasted $50 when we could've gone to a real authentic jamaican restaurant! Only reason I'm giving it a 2 star is because our server was great.  Never again!

4FjVPALzxU3cZzPIucigHg.text: Horrible drinks! No cigars after 9:30 Outside patio is cute.  Didn't have food but sounded good.   Shout out Issac, nice guy!

kAn1uxjnRcXl6quXicRBQw.text: Arizona seafood and rum...not words would normally put together..BUT. You cannot do better than this place. Say it with my folks..the owners are local and passionate about DTPHX. Danielle (chef) is on the forefront of seafood sustainability and a James Beard fellow. Dwayne (rum sommelier  is thee most knowledgeable person for rum in Phoenix. (Challenge me otherwise!)   It can be pricey ( I attribute this to Phoenicians being very spoiled when it comes to price points..myself included..we are a growing foodie scene and that's the price of admission..pun intended.)   This is great place to take someone special...or someone you want end things and not have a scene..(just kidding but you know what I'm saying)   Do yourself a favor and put this on your map

1BV6iq2PTsYqoChUwA68TA.text: If foodies are snobs, then call me a snob. After my meal at The Breadfruit and Rum Bar, you can also call me a deliriously satisfied snob.   When looking for a new restaurant, I have a few primary criteria: I want a place that prepares foods I don't, can't or won't cook myself. And I want food prepared by people who love to cook, and love to create a great dining experience. TB&RB met those criteria.  It was our 3rd date, and she loves great food perhaps even more than I do. So the bar for our mutual satisfaction was set pretty high. TB&RB cleared that bar with ease.   We started with cocktails. She told our waiter Isaac that she was a Cosmo girl, so he suggested the "Tamarind Ball II." Hers came with a candied tamarind that Isaac told her to nibble between sips. The smile on her face told me all I needed to know. She told me that she'd drink a gallon of it if it was available.  I'm a whisky guy myself, and this is a rum place. (Not a drop of whisky in the whole joint.) So at Isaac's recommendation, I had the "Punch Bowl Special," which is basically whatever the bartender is making that day. My drink was superb. A complex mix of flavors, all nicely balanced with a beautiful finish. Even though rum was the main spirit, it wasn't sweet. I would happily have it again. (And again. And again.)  For appetizers we chose the "Appleton Rum Sea Scallops" and the "Pepper Shrimp." The scallops were perfectly prepared. Grilled and crisp on the edges yet soft and buttery on the inside. Seasoned well, flavorful and spicy without being too much.  The Pepper Shrimp was excellent. The spices in the sauce were seriously hot, (which I like - a lot!), yet well balanced as well.   Deserving of special mention were the "fried greens" that came with the shrimp. Look, "greens" are generic and boring, right? How could they be worth mentioning? These were amazing. Delicate leaves of - what? baby spinach maybe? - crisp-fried, delicate and liberally savory. Pairing these feathery greens with the spicy shrimp took an already excellent dish to a whole 'nother level of awesomeness.   For entree's, she ordered the "Jerk Pork and Polenta", I took the "Curried Goat." Entree's called for new drinks so she ordered the "Kingston 5" and I had the "Johnny Appleseed."   As that first sip of Kingston 5 slipped past her lips, sheer pleasure washed across her face. She didn't have to say a thing. (As I man, I live to see that look on the face of a woman.) She asked Isaac for a gallon of that as well. (Joking, people. You don't get to take gallon jars of booze home with you. Or do you? Hmmm...)  My Johnny Appleseed was very good as well, (though it didn't quite give me mouth orgasms.) Remember, I like whisky. I don't even drink bourbon because I find it too sweet. Yet these drinks were all outstanding examples of the mixologist's craft and skill. I would happily order any of them again.  She loved the polenta and the pork was exactly as hoped for - tender, flavorful, spicy and balanced seasoning.   The flavor of the curry was very good, but I was a bit disappointed. Not because the dish wasn't good, but because it was "merely" good. Up to that point, everything else had been spectacularly good. The goat was more "meh" by comparison.   Isaac wouldn't accept "meh" and insisted I try something else. He suggested the Steamed Clams instead. He soon returned with a huge bowlful of beautiful clams swimming in a spicy, jerk-based sauce. They were perfectly cooked, tender without veering over into "chewy," and still residing in that spice/salt/heat neighborhood so characteristic of jerk flavors.   We finished the evening by sharing a mug of hot buttered rum. Somehow, I had made it to this point in my life without ever drinking real hot buttered rum.   Let me make one thing very clear: my life will forever be divided into two parts: the dull, gray, boring part prior to my first sip of hot buttered rum, and the beautiful, shiny technicolor part after that moment. It was that good.  The combination of rich buttery flavors, warm rum and silky texture in that drink - topped by a veritable mountain of freshly whipped cream... Well, it was the absolutely perfect ending to a nearly perfect meal. I would die a happy man if my last meal was a mug of that hot buttered rum.  We enjoyed almost 2 hours in culinary bliss, and it was worth every moment and every penny. Do yourself and someone special a favor. Go. Enjoy. Return.  Food: 5 Stars Atmosphere: 4 Stars Service: 5 Stars

TaIl72PmAnuSv7K4nI2kmQ.text: 5 stars for the ambience,  music, and service. When it comes to the food. I was very disappointed.  I love authentic Caribbean dishes and I was presented with a lack of flavor barely mature plantains.  The drinks are very similar to other places, nothing out of the ordinary. It was a True disappointment.  I believe the flavors and seasonings had to be adjusted to our population here in the states. Great service!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Plantain

J5-aqXUx5wEnHR4FktFHaQ.text: Great drinks and food! All around a top notch experience one of my favorite rum bars in Arizona!! Great food this is the only rum bar in AZ that has great food you cant go wrong here!

rMoOoC2zg6ijWz7yIRwDVw.text: The food is just okay - I wasn't impressed with the fish curry. It didn't taste remotely Caribbean apart from the fact that it was heavily peppered. The punch was tasty and I liked the Flights to Brazil rum trio. Service is poor - I had a reservation and still waited 20 minutes to be seated. I would return for drinks but not the food. The Public Market down the road has better pricing and more convincing food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

d4X-TsrCLuFoVhXjEMEReg.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in the entire country. I live in Washington, DC, but I always look forward to traveling to Phoenix because I love eating at Breadfruit & Rum. The cocktail with a hint of cayenne pepper and the Red Stripe Shrimp are excellent. They also do a great job with scallops. I've never had a bad dish at Breadfruit and Rum. Everything is great!

Hgv-uvcdLEGPC4HcuuZEtA.text: This is one the best Jamaican restaurants that I have ever been to in the USA! Everything is packed with amazing flavor and spices. Each meal is a unique experience in itself and the drinks are to die for. I highly recommend the Kingston 5, because it is packed with flavor and different types of rum. I don't drink rum often, but when I go to Breadfruit I do, because it never fails. Also, recommend; plantain chips, mussels, daily fish and festivals! The service is amazing and I wish they were open 24/7!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Escovitch Fish &amp; Festival
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roasted Plantains &amp; Mango Dip
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kingston 5

qH7sPVYSrphJU7XE4TR2JQ.text: If you are a foodie then this is where you need to go. The food is absolutely delicious. Worth every penny. The staff knows so much about the Caribbean dining culture. You can tell they put a lot of thought into their dishes. As someone who comes from a background of visiting multiple restaurants, this is one of my top picks!

dQjDfeK7Ebg1xOF7_UbJJA.text: If this cocktail bar was in NY, I would live inside it. What a total gem! I came here both nights that I was in Phoenix and I wish I was in town longer just to come to this place a third time. All the drinks I tried were phenomenal.   I have a tendency to always order drinks that sound good but end up being terrible to the point where I always have to drink the other person's drink. However, everything here was so good, no matter what I ordered, it was delicious. I don't think a bad cocktail exists here.   Cocktails are priced at $10-11 and personally I thought that was extremely cheap because I'm used to paying $15 for something of this caliber. So naturally, I had to order as many different cocktails as I could and I loved every single one of them.  In addition to drinks, I also had the rum cake ($9) and that was really good. The flavors were really pronounced and the tanginess of the orange really permeated through the rum cake. I don't like ginger so I had to take off the ginger on top but I can see why it was there.   Parking: Hard to find free parking on weekends but you can park in the parking lot right behind the restaurant if you don't plan to stay for too long. I was told you're not likely to get towed and luckily I wasn't even though I was there for several hours as I bar hopped.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kingston 5- bottled in-house daily
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Garrison
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kingston 5

_sl9QLyPhbsE7YhGxLdRGg.text: A slice of Caribbean in Arizona! I was referred to Breadfruit Rum Bar as I was on lookout for Caribbean style food. The ambiance and the staff is outstanding. Let me say I have been twice now and sat at the bar both visits. The first evening we heavy relied on the Bartenders for recommendations and they did an excellent job helping us out.  The daily secret rum punch is a MUST! (Make sure to Uber,Lyft take the bus or walk) these sneaky drinks can hit you fast!  We ordered roasted plantain with mango dip it was quite tasty, next up was the jerk chicken it was good not mind blowing but we finished it and felt very happy.  Second visit we picked up our NYC cousin from the airport it was late but he needed a snack after that flight.  We ordered jerk pork with polenta and we clearly liked the roasted plantain enough to order again. I will say i did like the jerk pork better than the chicken the chicken was a little over cooked.   All in all I gave it a 5 because the ambiance sitting at bar is excellent and very educational talking to bartenders sometimes it's just about the company and drinks and yes good food... doesn't have to be mind blowing but good food.   We will be back and maybe sit at a table maybe.....  Ps excellent Rum selection!!!

K7pyY0FtBtCupUMt1UWU2Q.text: I love this place! They have great service and their food is excellent, I recommend all my clients to come and try this place whether or not they are visiting from out of town! If you like spicy food try their peppered shrimp :)

r74B2ZI2g3UrCV64_VQ1sQ.text: Very cozy and romantic place for dinner or just drinks at the bar. The bartender is the best, very knowledgeable about the liquor and even its history. we always sit at the bar because we enjoy talking to the bartender and learning! Food is amazing and delicious too!

wGATEbfIm_oO7gVNL6cLXA.text: This is one of my favorites always good.  I usually rate based on food, service and environment and to get a 5 star review you must be amazing.  Best Drinks!!!!  Enjoy.

DluEm-Ub8_72Q7b7ihsPIw.text: I had a great time here! Isaac and Janiel made my night! Great service and accommodating to our party! I'd come back definitely!! Thanks guys. So helpful with suggestions! Great job!!!

7mggYtRzFEM9izwUtrWm8w.text: What am I missing here?? This place has been on my bookmarks for a long time and I finally got a chance to go last night and i left feeling nothing... No real wow at the experience.  Service was excellent, our gal was great... No complaints there.  Between my husband and my dishes and the two appetizers and 2 desserts, nothing really was AHmazing. I also didn't hear any comment of "wow" from our friends from their dishes.  Appetizer: Sea Scallop and the Ceviche. For a party of 4, you should definitely increase the portion, this was equivalent to 1.5bites per person of the ceviche and the scallops were 2.. for 4 people.  come one... snobbery. Scallops were flavorful but ceviche was ok. Disappointing.  Entrees: Salmon dish and pork & polenta dish. My salmon was tasty but not memorable.  My husband had the same comment about his pork & polenta dish: nothing to talk about.  Cocktails: Gin & Co, Bootleg Smitty.  My husband did not like his Gin & co drink.  I tried it myself and it was not tasty.  My friend's bootleg smitty was delicious, though... I think really the only thing that stood out the entire night: one great cocktail.  Dessert: they only offer two (really neither sounded appealing to me but I wanted some kind of uplifting meal to end the disappointing apps and dinner). Carrot cake: ugh, no. The only thing I enjoyed on there were the fried carrots.. everything else was a blur.  The sweet pot pie. No way.... I didn't find any flavor or anything about it that said 'dessert'.  I've never ordered dessert anywhere and not taken several bites - it's dessert, how do you go wrong?  Writing all this I feel like I literally flushed way too much money down the drain.  I know downtown dining is more expensive, and I'm ok with that, but to not be wowed or even impressed with your meal is borderline insulting.  Like they're telling you you're paying for the privilege to eat here... no thanks.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tiny portion for 4!
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious, the only thing that stood out

2wN-LTVt01N_wryqyxV4mg.text: Amazing cocktails! If you are a True connoisseur of fine cocktails, please come here! We got the selector daiquiri, mojito, punch bowl special, Kingston 5, hurricane Charlie and bootlegger and all are 5 star. If you love rum and incredible cocktails, please come here! Also, Isaac was a great server!

71ROIPDBepbKAAbeb8eDHw.text: Great food and ambiance. It is located in downtown Phoenix not far from the ASU campus. My husband and I started out with the fish fritters and plantains w/mango chutney. Both were solid and beautiful. We ordered the house made ginger beer and a paradise cocktail. Both were good. The ginger beer was amazing though. For dinner we had tamarind whole grilled fish -excellent. Also, the vegetable melange also very good. Lots of ambiance, friendly staff, and nice place for a date. Only downside was the amount if light, a bit hard to see your food and only one dessert on menu when we came. Otherwise, would highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fvTGDSN0zQPkpvPKLDRvcA.text: A group of us dined at The Breadfruit during a conference.  If there were a plethora of choices downtown, we may not have tried it but we are glad we did!  We had no problem getting a table relatively late on a Tuesday night.  The restaurant is not particularly large for dining indoors and the outdoor space was closed.  There is a small and cozy bar area.  The menu is varied with some traditional Jamaican/Caribbean dishes like jerk spiced chicken, fish cooked in a banana leaf and curried goat.  We were pleased to also find two creative vegetarian dishes.  The preparation is upscale - this is not your hole-in-the-wall kind of place.  The cocktails are limited to rum drinks (including some classics made with rum) and a couple of beers.  The service was attentive and friendly.  If I were in the area again on business, I'd definitely check out Breadfruit again.

SFWd_Sy0ivR9qNyxyMKZvQ.text: The buttered rum is the best drink they serve. Try it.  If I had one complaint it's the cigar lounge. It's small and is often full. I kind of think the cigar lounge should just be removed since it's hard to get already and the space could be used for more restaurant customers. This is coming from someone who likes cigars and cigar lounges. But when I think of a cigar lounge, it's got to be accessible and stress free. I wouldn't go out of my way for the cigar lounge here because it's always full.

g8D9jIDpPQdR-CxVKtDyVQ.text: My fiancee and I came here on First Friday a few weeks back, so things were a little crazy. Luckily, we had brought our own beer, so we were able to crack one open while sitting in the grass waiting for a table. Eventually we were seated out front, so we had an excellent spot for people watching.  We started out with the plantain avocado spring rolls. They were golden-crispy and delicious. The Chutney really made them--without they would have been pretty bland.  For dinner I got the curried tofu, and my gentleman friend ordered the brown chicken stew. This was not his first choice, but they were out of the other two entrees he had in mind. We also went through a confusing few rounds of we're out of this, nope, we have it, no, actually...with our server on my tofu. Luckily everything that came out of the kitchen was fabulous. The tofu had a great consistency, nice and chewy, and the coconut rice and beans were rich and filling. The brown chicken stew was also good (says my man).  Overall: great atmosphere, great food, a little hit or miss with menu options (it was a busy night). I'll definitely be back.

QQrZCDA9cn9LBOKNbcmKPg.text: This review is a four for the classic mojitos and a one for the service. It is a damn shame because those are the best mojitos I have had in Phoenix but the service is so damn shitty. Don't get me wrong, the bartenders are nice but damn, do they all need to act like a bunch of potheads? I first came here for their Grand Opening and after things had died down, waited at the bar for 10 minutes before waving them down for a drink. They kept walking past me (looking down the whole time) and then would crowd around the computer trying to figure out the tickets. Very unorganized. My friends and I ended up leaving because of how long it would take to get a drink with 3 bartenders. I gave it another chance last night and the service was the same. It had been a good 10-15 minutes before the bartender asked if we wanted another mojito. My husband was pissed because he wanted to order food and they never checked up on that after giving us a menu. As we were sitting at the bar, a guy walks up and tells the bartender, "Um, we need menus for our 9 top over there in the corner." He seemed very irritated. The girl hands him menus and walks over to the bartender with the blond dreads and says something about him forgetting about the table. I can't say I was surprised AT ALL. The same male bartender forgot my first drink when I came to the grand opening. My husband and I really want to have dinner in the restaurant but are afraid the inattentive service extends to the servers. The menu looks delicious so maybe we'll have to do take-out.

0btqfnF8GajpF9nSfH9dGA.text: It's not the best Carribbean restaurant I've been to, but I did like that they had some unique items on the menu. The rum glazed prawns with roti were good. The mussels dish came with tons of mussels and a flavorful broth. The dessert was a disappointment, but I would give it another try and try another item if I am in Phoenix again.

KFTxMP_eG8FW9xdyaAEUjQ.text: What is there to say about this place that hasn't already been said? Well first off, they need to bring the spicy beef Pattie's back!!! Seriously!  The Tilapia Pattie is fantastic. Plantain Avocado spring rolls are good as well. Festivals are great as well, but save them for a desert.  Jerk chicken and shrimp? Its a staple here. Get it, its good. Spicy so "Watch your mouth!"   Escovitch Fish can't be beat for a downtown fish dish. Its runner up for best sleeper dish on the menu.  And....the award for best sleeper of the menu.....  Brown stew chicken! Come get some! It is a fantastic "total" dish. Expect to see an empty plate when you are done. The entire dish is delightful.   The only downer: The BYOB seems a little steep if drinking individual beers...but I guess that just means bring a six pack at a time...hah...

bYzVdnKmYurdzGeAw4a0tA.text: Great food, great service. Bring your own wine and people that love food, and you'll have great time!! Must try the carrot juice...trust me!   Only metered street parking, and the meters are 1 hour. Bring change and be prepared to run out and feed the meter. On the upside, you can see the street from any table, so you can keep an eye out for the Meter Reader!

O1Kv8P2HKsYK1W_JcnFt3Q.text: I had a friend, another Jamaican, with a couple of hours layover in Phoenix so I picked him up and headed to this restaurant as it seemed the closest to the airport. The staff was very friendly and we didn't have to wait too long for service. I have to admit this small establishment was just about on of the fanciest  of the Jamaican restaurants I have visited in north america. This doesn't usually bode well with me because, from my personal experience, the fancier the restaurant, the more they stray from the authenticity of the cuisine by trying to please the american palate. We eschewed the nouvelle cuisine menu items obvious there to please that crowd and  ordered the Escovitch Fish and Jerk Chicken since my favourite "ox-tail" was nowhere on the menu and that is the dish most jamaicans use to test the excellence of our restaurants. I guess it doesn't ring well in a fancy place. Anyway, as a Kingstonian, I am used to going to a beach area where they cook up the best escovitch fish, corned with country pepper (habanero) and onions and dripping with grease but just finger licking good. That was not the case here but it was a darn righ better that I could have whipped up in my kitchen at home. I think most americans will probably enjoy it but I will wait until I am back home or at a greasy spoon in Brooklyn or one of the many Florida cities with large jamaican communities. The jerk chicken was also nothing like you would get back home but exotic enough for vacationers to the island needing a bit of nostalgia. The rice and peas was missing something. I am not sure what exactly but suspect it didn't have any coconut milk or not enough. Anyway, I have other jamaican friends who have enjoyed other dishes here so I have not given up yet and plan to return and sample a few other dishes. I have been craving breadfruit, roast or friend so I hope I wont be disappointed.

CKHc2oDzr1WSSNSFAk8Xaw.text: Heard about The Breadfruit in an article in Az Vines & Wines. It sounded so good we couldn't wait to try it. It was OUTSTANDING!! The drinks..the service..the staff was amazing..& the food just incredible. We can't wait to go again. Highly recommend it. We just moved here from the East coast & we are trying as many rest as we can. This place is a must..

wi5-x0MSUwZ6zObxa_m-pA.text: Bleh.  I'm sorry Breadfruit, but I will not be back.  I was really excited to try this place when we heard it was opening.  I've said before that I don't like Mexican spicy but I do like Asian spicy.  I forgot to add that I also like Caribbean spicy.  Finally, a place in downtown to get some good Caribbean/Jamaican food.  Boy was I wrong.  We met a couple friends here and when we walked in, I loved the decor.  It looks just like the inside of my house with the bright colored walls and the exposed brick and ductwork.  Unfortunately, my love for this place stops there.  We decided to order the Plaintain Avocado Spring rolls.  Taste wise, these were okay on the first bite, the more you ate, the less distinguishable the flavors got.  It was really just a big mess of mush inside a soggy wonton type wrapper.  The dipping sauce was tasty though.  I ordered the Jerk Shrimp and it came with a side of rice and beans.  The tails were removed from the shrimp, which was really nice to not have to take care of myself.  Unfortunately the shrimp were not cooked very well.  They were quite tough and had this weird crispiness to them.  The flavor on the shrimp was ridiculously overpowering.  I know I am a bit of a wimp when it comes to heat and spice, but this was too much.  I couldn't taste anything besides the spice, even after downing my entire bottle of pineapple soda, which was way too sugary.  Everyone else's food looked decent, but overcooked.  One dish, the stew, looked like baby diarrhea.  Honestly.  The highlight of the meal was the little breadstick thing they serve alongside the food.  It was pretty good.  Sorry Breadfruit, I will continue to pass by you in favor of better restaurants like the Turf.

uqZjCt9RHrUmIFahsX2zYQ.text: Came here while at a conference downtown because it came up on the results for "vegetarian" in Phoenix.  It didn't disappoint - both the soy chunk curry and the pop cho were very tasty, as were the avocado and plantain spring rolls we got.  I'd expected them to be raw/cold, but they were good fried and hot.  Also, the My Favorite Carrot Juice is delicious.  I may try to replicate it at home in the event I ever get a juicer.  The sorrel was good, too.

AVjpO2YW6iVs1dA17lWuDg.text: Parked in front of this place while going to visit the Phoenix Public Market. We were pleasantly surprised to find out there were no freezers or microwaves in this restaurant, so that tells you right there that you are receiving fresh, well prepared food. We had to try the Jerk plates as it was  Caribbean food. The spice was nice and the food was delicious. The only thing that would make us not go back was the small portions for the price, but at least you know you are paying for quality. They also had blue mountain coffee, which was awesome! All in all, if you have extra money & want to taste something different & good, this is the place.

h-621hsO0MpxnyFT8SacOg.text: The food is good, but way overpriced.  The service is awful, I have been on three separate occasions, and each time i end up leaving angry that the waitstaff or owner has somehow managed to insult me.   for the money i would much rather go somewhere nicer.

a7N83Wolv46NY9RLhgg0NA.text: 3.5 Stars for Rum Bar, 4.0 for BreadFruit.  Bar was out of ginger beer, which eliminated the best cocktails on the menu.  Those that I tried instead were just ok.  But interesting cocktail menu with decent happy hour options (at $5).  I agree with the prior reviews on Breadfruit -- quality food, authentic menu, good service, but higher prices than what you'd expect.  Good tunes on the playlist and a good first date place.

yBTYwgZGgEMRiQU-HnECww.text: The food was really good.  I liked everything I tried.  It;s a little different that they dont do take-out and they are not very accommodating with substitutions and special requests but the food is very satisfying so I will be back.  We went for lunch and I look forward to going for dinner and the new RumBar.

jFMkAihn6S1VYHH4tpjK1w.text: Excellent food, service and atmosphere.  Jose was super friendly and acommodating.  Haven't tried drinks or dinner yet ,will update review when we do.

m1GpMxA1hO64KTeHZiHtdA.text: Went early during First Friday last week and scored a spot at the bar. Thank god for that, because this place was tiny, and I wouldn't recommend it for groups.  Having said that, we ordered whatever the bartender suggested (4 different drinks in all), and found them all to be outstanding. We would've liked to try some of their rums, but there was no help offered figuring out how to sample those--it's a bit overwhelming!  The nice thing is that you can order food from the adjoining restaurant. However, the jerk spice on the perfectly cooked scallops was so spicy that I could not eat it.

uSomcULMurf-YAiooFE3nA.text: Hearty, simple and to the point.  When I think of Jamaica, I think of a simple way of life that still has a bite to it.  The breadfruit is a wonderful reflection of that.  The dishes aren't presented in a flashy manner, nor is the ambiance posh.  However, the flavor is the focal point and that point is well taken.  The jerk chicken is my favorite dish, the chicken is so damn moist on the inside while the jerk seasoning on the outside brings tears to your eyes.  Wonderful.

G95vZmLjKCLZuN7cWcA6SA.text: This little place absolutely rocks your tastebuds!  Have visited twice and will make it a regular lunch stop.  The jerk chicken is absolutely delicious, and yes a bit spicy... as it should be.  We've also had the avocado-plantain spring rolls (amazing) and the spinach pattie.  The mango lemonade with mint is so refreshing and tasty.    Don't deprive yourself of lunch at The Breadfruit... one of downtown's very best.  UPDATE: they no longer serve lunch.

lvnI03N1IMJrfWrNU663QQ.text: I tried this place out for the first time with a party of seven this last First Friday. The food was to die for. If you don't like spicy food you should tell them; but, I got the jerk chicken and it was perfectly cooked and amazingly seasoned. My friend got the scallops and they were probably the best I've had in Phoenix. We had to wait a while for our table (not surprised since we had a large group and it was Friday night) but they had a a live band playing in the back, a great seating area to wait in and a great drink list (even though I don't really like rum). I will definitely be coming back.

7z0An0kvju2U01RDlvpmCA.text: We went to Breadfruit last night for a Saturday dinner. When we got there, there were two other couples on the place, but it filled up while we were eating (which means two other parties sat down...the place is lovely and tiny).   Our waiter (owner? not sure) was extremely enthusiastic about the menu and the special appetizer of the day, which was jerk scallops. He REALLY wanted us to order them. Well fine, I love scallops, so why not. And they were excellent! My only complaint: there were two scallops and they cost more than each of our meals! Had I known that ahead of time (and no I didn't ask), I wouldn't have ordered them. But it's a small complaint.  The food: everything was very tasty. I ordered the brown chicken stew and DH ordered the jerk chicken, and he even liked the mango salsa that came with it (he usually scrapes all strange and exotic food items to the side of his plate).   We also had the avocado plantain rolls for appetizers, and they were great. The special drinks are also quite delicious.  The place is clean bright, and fun. I would definitely go again to sample some other menu items.

aF3t-ynXHzboKTgoOEDT-Q.text: Have eaten here three times and each time the food is delicious , especially the pulled pork and the jerk shrimp,also they akwsys have a special rum drink that totally satisfies when we re in the mood for an island feel. Service is spot on and friendly. Parking can be an issue at busy times, but worth a try .

4Scvs_KWRLin_ra6BujVaA.text: The Breadfruit and Rumbar has been serving downtown Phoenix patrons tasty Jamaican food since 2008, but I finally checked it out for the first time this past weekend. I fell in love with it instantly and can't wait to go back.  The Breadfruit and Rumbar is a charming Jamaican eatery with an extensive selection of more than 100 rums. I had one of my new favorite cocktails there, the changing-daily Punch Bowl Special ($9), made with fresh pomegranate and cranberry juices. It was so refreshing, plus pretty strong, and I could have sipped them all night long. And if you're into cigars, you can purchase one there to pair with your rum, too.  We started with the Plantain Avocado Spring Rolls ($8.50), paired with a mango chutney. If you like the avocado rolls at Kona Grill, you'll definitely like these. And it's nice to know The Breadfruit locally sources all their menu items, so everything is extremely fresh.  I'm usually not a huge tofu fan, but I took the recommendation of our server to order the Coconut Curry Tofu ($11.50). It was a really hearty, delicious dish, and the tofu reminded me of chicken bits -- I really liked it. The rice and beans (they're called "peas" on the menu) was my favorite part of the dish, which also came with veggies and plantains. It was a great variety of foods and really filling. I'd highly recommend it.  My boyfriend got the Jerk Chicken ($12), which he said was the best jerk chicken he'd ever had.  Besides the tasty food, the atmosphere at The Breadfruit was so pretty. The lounge area was dark and sophisticated -- you won't find any sports televisions -- and the main dining room was small and cozy. Service was excellent, and I'd recommend it as a great date place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The exterior
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut Curry Tofu ($11.50)
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jerk Chicken ($12)

s6RkbEoSc6sg0U920YQacg.text: One of our cousins was in town visiting, so we decided to bring her to The Breadfruit and Rum Bar for cocktails and dinner.  This place exceeded our expectations.  The food is absolutely delicious.  This isn't a hole-in-the-wall type of ethnic places (although I do love those); this is a classy joint with fancy gorgeously-plated dinner items.  Portions are a little small, but the taste more than makes up for that.  I had the Brown Stew Chicken, which is less of a stew and more of melt-in-your-mouth chicken in brown sauce.  I also sampled the Jerk Chicken (great spices) and the Coconut Mackerel Rundown (like a tunafish on a chewy wonton - I've never tasted anything like it before, but it was delicious as weird as it sounds).  The cocktails were so well-crafted, with really subtle flavors that paired well with our meals.  The daily rum special (in a large punch bowl out front) was a guava-inspired drink so I was in heaven.  I also sampled the Mr. Smith (very strong and with great flavors again), the Shim Sham (light and fruity) and the Bourbon Masquerade (very aptly named- it tasted so much like bourbon).  The creativity and flavor of the cocktails were fantastic, and the place has a literal wall of rum to choose from when designing their drinks.  The prices are a little expensive, but it's definitely worth it for a special night.  The only thing holding me back from giving 5/5 stars was the service.  Our waitress was a little pushy, appearing visibly upset when we didn't order a "small plate" appetizer to go with our entrees and drinks, and she came off as cold and somewhat snobby overall.  Still, probably only one person, and maybe she was just having a bad night.  Overall, check this place out!  Great way to experience Jamaican food.

9KIyIBRgY3d-PY3_y78HJA.text: Cute place that is tucked into a side street. Quaint on the inside and staff was very informative. Red Snapper was good, but the plantains were the highlight. Walking distance to Symphony Hall and other spots.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Red Snapper. Yum.

dQB_VZ_7C1XtXsmpGUnSPw.text: My new favorite place. The mixologists take their craft seriously and each cocktail is a work of art. They make their own syrups, no bottled mixes here. Appreciate the authentic reggae music playing in the background and the beautiful ambiance. A relaxed, but higher-end establishment. In addition, an intimate outdoor back patio with tropical island feel and lots of humidity pumping through the misters for cigar smoking. Cigars sold there as well.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Garnishes for the cocktails. Apple slice with a sage leaf embedded, tamarind fruit, rose buds to name a few.

dtuTyb5LXxf_OHCbNWy1ZQ.text: Very disappointed with this restaurant.  Planned to meet friends for dinner so i called  breadfruit  on Wednesday to make a reservation for Saturday evening at 6:30.  We arrived on time and the restaurant had no record of my reservation.  They told us that they Couldn't  give us a table for over an hour!  We left and had a nice dinner at another restaurant.

8tKffjEMdQzL9OeJtmHX6A.text: This place was more than I could've expected. We visited this place during a visit to Phx. It was great from start to finish. The service was great. The server made all of the right recommendations. Drinks superb! Food great and the rum cake exploded with flavor in my mouth. I will visit this place when I return.

Puj8YXNPH6WnJI5WuPBXhw.text: I found this place on yelp and decided to check it out. I loved that they played island music and the drinks were great.  Server was very nice and knowledgeable of the menu.  My fiance' had the escovish fish which was really good.  The place is small and intimate so go with someone you like!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Escovish ( not sure of spelling) Fish nice and spicy!
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled jerk chicken with mango chutney!

PtDSyFvxMDqk7A5JMrtbhA.text: We met some friends here last night for dinner and drinks.
