It is just a unique taste for Phoenix so it makes me happy.  Now... With that said... The experience of going there takes some getting used to. First no matter what ALWAYS make a reservation. They are not busy all the time but they ALWAYS ask you to take a seat and WAIT even if you have reservation. But at least with reservation they don' t tell you it is going to be 20mn even though the restaurant is half empty. So there... You've been warned. Make a reservation, take a seat, it will be worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jerk pork and polenta!

iLM6nzyIPhSOcYkWIyCDoA.text: Went last night after hearing rave reviews.  Everything was spectacular.  Our server (Christian) knew it was our anniversary and took great care of us.  The food was incredible and the cocktails were top notch.  The place is beautiful, cozy and intimate.  For a moment I felt like I was not in Phoenix, which I was grateful for.

8fGiZkXbDwNztnV9S7UotQ.text: If I could give this place zero stars I would. But since I have to give a minimum of one the only plus in this place was the food. I've been in the restaurant industry for years and this is by far one of the strangest experiences I've ever had...  My beautiful bride and I walk in and ask for a table for two when they open. Bartender says do you have reservations? Not one person in the place. Host says next time please try to get reservations. 30 minutes later still the only ones in the restaurant.  One of the waitresses tried to bring something behind the bar, and I actually heard the bartender Yell at her to get it out from behind the bar.   Our server came over to take our order. When my wife ordered the salmon she wanted the sauce on the side. The server said no. I asked why she couldn't have it on the side. She said because there are no substitutions as you can read at the bottom of the menu.   I can honestly say again that I've never experienced anything like this in my life. We will never be going back.

2Ox3WGkRKZ8PfY2kOk4-fw.text: I didn't know what to expect but had a great experience here.  Very thoughtful menu and cocktail program both of which were -- thankfully -- well outside of the typical "New American" Phoenix menus where 85% of the menu is the same everywhere.  Good service and ambiance.

GLFct5RHFpukkq1xX-IbzQ.text: My fiancee and I have visited the rum bar on numerous occasions with various combinations of friends, and recommended it to countless others. Being rum enthusiasts (my fiancee herself is caribbean) we were thrilled when we initially thought was a hidden gem. This place has gone downhill, and we must not be the only ones who think so as it was almost empty tonight. Won't be going back anymore.   The problem, I think, boils down to attitude on the part of the staff, which I'm guessing starts with the ownership. For example, their Tamarind Ball II drink comes with a nice sweet tamarind ball on top as a garnish. My fiancee loves these so when we went tonight we asked if we could have a second on the cocktail. The waitress said sure and it would be a $1. No problem. The bartender, across the room, starts violently shaking his head NO! He informs us (still across the room) that these things take 9 hours (!!!!111!!!1) to make and that we could not have any extra. We were literally the only people in the room an hour before close. Not to mention you can get a bag of tamarind ball (candy essentially) for $3 at food city. Just sloppy customer service. The bartender seemed to take great pleasure in saying no.    On top of that, being regulars, we've seen the cocktail menu change a few times and we have some favorites of old times. Not only do we know their names but we know their ingredients. Tonight we tried to order an older drink, and were informed that if its not on the menu, they won't make it. Plenty of other bars reward (and even admire) their regulars for their loyalty and enjoy the nostalgia of older drinks. Here, I'm guessing the bartender was just too green judging by how much time the owner spent correcting him.   To finish it off, I must mention the owner. He gets a lot of credibility around Phoenix as a rum guy and I've always admired him for being an ambassador of the spirit. If you've ever seen him at an event though or had the misfortune of being sat by him at the rum bar you'd know he's got quite an air of superiority about him. Tonight he sat at the bar, feet from us and heard us complain. Again we were the only table (a 5 top) for over an hour on a Thursday night. He said not a word to us. Never asked after the food or the drinks. Never thanked us for coming in. Never offered to explain any of the menu or the options. He just sat at the bar, until a minute to close when he quickly gathered his things and left the place.  I imagine the staff dislikes being here as much as I do, so I don't fault them for this. I do fault the owner though. Rum deserves better. Caribbean food deserves better. Phoenix deserves better.

lF4sSBdqdQ7dWaKLU1CKrA.text: Let me tell ya, Breadfuit has really got my goat.   No, really...they offer a local Mountain Goat dish on their menu.  Offering meats and produce from local (or at least from sustainable) farms, this snug retreat has you loungin' you in da island, mon.  Arriving in a sand-colored, seemingly residential area, I was surprised to see the glowing "RUM" sign.  Eureka - I was in the right place.  Nautical ropes lead you to the front door, opening on the lounge area and impressive rum collection (over 100 varieties, in fact!). Cozying up in the corner to get a good shot for you lovely Yelpers, and someone (possibly staff?) proceeded to ignore my positioning and squashed me between the door and the brick wall.   - eiy.  After I got over my self-importance, I complimented the rum punch bowl and followed our waiter, Ryan, to our table-pour-duo.  At 8pm on a Wednesday night, we were two of five people in the joint (which is good, because it's a pretty small space).  Setting to the menu, I had to hold back my surprise (the prices before me were a bit higher than the online menu).  Nonetheless, I knew what my order was destined to be: the Blue Mountain Curried Goat (with farm veg, Blue Mountain curry marinade, and basmati rice $22).  When do you get that opportunity in New England??!  The dish was flavorful (sweet and spicy and plate-licking GOOD!) and plentiful....but I doubt that you'd be able to resist the temptation to scoop up every last bite.  Not into goat?  How about Rum? - The cocktail menu is just how I like it: in courses!  Each concoction offers freshly squeezed juices, tonic made in-house (like...soda stream?), aaaaand massive blocks of ice (sucks up a lot of space in the glass, but at least you don't have to worry about ice chip avalanche when you're going for the last drops of your bev).  The  Fifth & Company : a ginger brew + raspberry + bergamot essence + Mt. Gay Eclipse rum ($10).  Off the cuff, I was unimpressed (10$ for *maybe* 6oz of cocktail??  That's steep, even for Boston standards).  But sipped over the course of the evening, I found it to be a pleasant surprise of a beverage.  Sweet / tangy / zippy sips - totally worth it.  Full from the goat, I almost passed up on dessert (thank goodness my dining partner talked me out of THAT mistake).  We ordered the Jamaican puddin' pie (NO 'G'!) with rum-infused whipped cream.  It was a small sliver of a slice, but the custard-like pie was sweet and filling (can I take a tub of that whip to go?).  All in all, a great dinner (albeit, a pricey one - about $90 for two) with an excellent cocktail.  The lounge space is large enough to prevent crowding, yet small enough to create that warm intimate feel that warms you right up.  A great choice for a private party, or a relaxed semi-casual first date - - - if you can find the place.  Order up the Mollasses Fried Lollipops (chicken lollies?!) and let me know how they are!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mountain goat curry!
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Short ribs stew (increeedible sauce youll want to bathe in...unless youre a xow)
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Boston eat your Irish heart out (8oz for %10)

aPgtQwELpiCGqbbN00zMlg.text: This place was amazing! Food was so full of flavor and very fresh and local. We were expecting Caribbean food but not this good. Jerk chicken was so good who knew rice could be so flavorful. Pepper shrimp so spicy wonderlish. We will definitely be back. Reservations needed as very full even in summer.

MRm837VjzDEZ9t1_6iGdAg.text: Everything about this restaurant was incredibly,the servers were great, the rum drink was out of this world I had an appetizer and then the   Salmon the whole meal was fantastic, little bit on the expensive side but it was well worth it

nKjuxRPJPLp3RDvoT5Ysuw.text: Sat at the bar for cocktails and dessert. Love their selection of run concoctions. Had the rum cake. Will go back for dinner.

mphQ5gfXQxbZHTOa3WTzuw.text: Oh yeah! This place is unlike any other. The absolute best rum drinks in the city. When you hear Rum bar, don't think Rum Runners on Spring Break, think about where Don Draper would want a glass of rum if he was in the Caribbean.  The food his high quality Jamaican. The jerk sauce is so spicy and so good. Great place to take a date, or a friend from out of town. They also have cigars you can buy and smoke on the back patio...if you're in to that sort of thing.

uEnIVi8hkq_OEsDVGchXHg.text: They called to confirm, which was good as I then had the Phone # handy as the show we were at ran longer (after starting later) than we anticipated. They graciously accommodated us (party of 4). Great specialty cocktails and the food did not disappoint (as usual)!!

OH7FnsETnEgJWvapRYiP4w.text: Not a fan. We sat outside and there were flies EVERYWHERE. I don't know why they wouldn't have citronella or something. The food is crazy overpriced, but it is tasty. I can't rationalize the $14 we spent on 2 scallops. Overall, as good as the food was, we won't be dining here again.

boRqk0i8-w739V1Tl9eViA.text: My girl and I have eaten here for years, despite the little negativities here and there (they won'tnlet you order to-go food, waiters reluctant to bring table salt, etc).  We decided to eat there about a week-and-a-half ago.. when we arrived it was about an hour prior to closing. There were 3 tables open on the patio. When we asked about sitting on the patio, the host literally grimaced! Then explained that "there wasn't seating for two" on the patio.  An hour before you close?? Multiple tables open outside??? On a THURSDAY NIGHT?? Really?  So, rather than dignifying the hosts response with an "oh okay" I said, "Thanks. We'll check back." (then finished that sentence to my gf with "when hell freezes over."   So,  We actually walked right around the corner to Pomo Pizzeria and were served a world-class meal, had an awesome server, were greeted by the chef himself because he brought us a complimentary dessert..  ALL without ever hearing a word about how the Breadfruit employ treated us earlier.   Last,  we drove past the Breadfruit on our way and saw that the 3 open tables were now 4. Guess they don't care about our silly $100 2-top but hey..  keep up that rep guys! :)

o4E91drgYNsFkl7OUaLyhw.text: Went here for my birthday dinner.  Cool looking place from the outside kind of small inside and very noisy.  Besides patrons yelling to talk over the noise there's music playing too.  Wouldn't recommend for a romantic dinner.  All kind of rum drinks so you better like rum, 2 beer choices and one red and one white Arizona wine.  Wife had the salmon and I had the jerk pork.  Both dishes ok but not memorable. Only one dessert available and didn't sound that good so didn't order it.  Would go to Hula's before this place.  Better food, better choice of drinks, more food and more reasonably priced.  Probably won't be back.

EQ8iikE1j5Pv1CYIAHFo4g.text: The food is good for the most part.  Salt is their favorite ingredient so if you really like to taste the food.  You won't.  The ingredients are top notch.  I did not try any of the drinks but they looked good and many others were enjoying them.  This would be a good place to have a drink before a show.

Y6yKTJlQoEuyxQw3ntrKeg.text: Review update  Changed to 5 stars - I've visited this place more often and have had nothing but good experience. The owner seems to be always present and has greeted us personally every time we come in. They have good food, good drinks and good service, what else can I say.

RyucvXG0tznkfDmAtLxF1w.text: The restaurant is quaint ! Very pretty ! Unfortunately the food is not as good as the place looks and the prices are not to put with the food either !!too pricey for a mediocre meal !!!!The pork chop  is so tough!! You would expect a soft cut and such but they didn't cook it well t was like eating shoe leather. The crab cakes are just bread  barely any crab such a rip off  !! They should invest on providing quality food having such a cute place . The server was confused and scattered. My whole party was Unimpressed with the food. Would not recommend for food but only for drinks and the ambience.

ygVGjonIgX6XKU8wdg6ZOw.text: So, we walk in and ask to sit on the patio in one of the 3 open tables. They say "no" the patio is only for groups of 4. Then they ask us if we have a reservation. We say "no" and they ask us to wait to be seated, even though the whole place was practically empty.   Then we get the menu and order Mojitos. The mojitos were small for $10, but they had real spearmint (good, because the tap water tasted bad, so I used it for my water....which trust me you will need with the food).  Then we try to order, but 5 jerk options were unavailable and one pork chop option was replaced with Quail. So we go for the scallops appetizer, the shredded pork jerk and the coconut curry.  We asked for some bread while we waited, they do a garlic bread appetizer (not good). The wait bothered my date a little, because they served the people who walked in after us right away. I didn't like that it was super freezing inside and really loud so I couldn't hear the waiter (bad acoustics). We managed to have some loud but good conversation over mojitos and convinced them to light our tea light for warmth/comic relief.  They play a lot of Bob Marley to make up for the bad acoustics, otherwise we would definitely hear word for word everything being said.   Eventually food came. It was presented really well, but not easy to eat. The scallops caused a histamine reaction right away for me (not sure if it was the sauce...maybe liquid smoke...I'm not allergic to sea food). They serve a really cute palate cleanse in-between courses.   I had trouble with the curry dish items, cabbage didn't lend itself to be cut, or as finger food. The tofu was a change of pace, sauce was mild, rice super bland, and tiny bit of candied plantain were super good.  I tried my date's sweet potato side and that was pretty mellow. But my date got an upset stomach later, had some pepto bismouth and his tongue turned scary black from the reaction of all the charcoal in the food and the bismouth.  (In response to comments on this post, we are aware Bismouth can cause this reaction alone, but it had not happened before.The goal is to not need Pepto Bismouth after dinner.)  We had a nice time anyway; that's how we roll. But it was $80 for both of us with tip and it just didn't seem worth it. ---It's like they're trying to be something in L.A. or NYC. (No SF restaurant would act so pompous about seating.) Although I did appreciate the local sourced food. Their deserts sounded fantastic so if I go back it will just be for desert.

9F-ooXPX9XI3CntZHOsonQ.text: This is a cute little place for dinner and a drink but make reservations! I was with a party of four, two in the group had been here before. We decided to wait the 30 minutes for a table because they said the food was that good even though the Yelp ranking was a little low.  The waitress and a sidekick with a mustache that reminded me of Salvador Dali's arrived at the table. They had that aura about them that made my dining experience entertaining  and brings a smile to my face every time I think about their performance.  My entree was the three stripe shrimp, and it was spicy and full of what I would expect to find in a flavorful Jamaican dish. I also tasted all of the entrees at my table and found none lacking. My table also ordered the two desserts that were offered by the waitstaff duo, a breadfruit and a chocolate Creme brulee. Both were very good and worth any health risks from sugar or caloric waste.  Tasting all the drinks at my table, my favorites were the pina colada and the ginger infused rum drink. My lovely waitress suggested that the pina colada would be the best that I have ever tasted, and yes, it ranks up there particularly since the trips to the rum factory in the Caribbean are a little hazy to recall.  So, a solid 4 star food and drink experience, but the outstanding performance of sophistication from the waitstaff takes this to a 5 star standout.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Creme brûlée
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp

3-xZ0hpIt9pQR_pEbNLGBQ.text: This was a lovely unique dining experience. Food was delicious and the staff was extremely attentive. The ambiance was quaint and inviting. We went on a date night there but would recommend for any experience. If Rum is your Jam this is your spot. Extensive specially Rum drink menu all paired with the dishes.

jLiELqoo5kdcrHROaujdiQ.text: Excellent jerk chicken, and the My Favorite Carrot Juice is superb!

fL8WBc09X4WN8qJJVYnKxA.text: I have been here twice with my girlfriend for various celebrations. The first time, Isaac took care of us. He did it so well that on our next visit we had to request him, and THAT is where he really wowed us. His extensive knowledge on the food and drinks were amazing. He was able to give us extremely detailed descriptions of the flavors of a few dishes and drinks we were torn between in order to help us make a decision. From that whole dinner, the True standout was a pan-seared steelhead salmon with a tamarind reduction. The salmon was very juicy and moist, but perfectly crispy around the edges. I was curious as to how the typically potent tamarind flavor would fit with the salmon. I don't know how they did it, but the dish was out-freaking-standing. We were also curious to learn more about the whole restaurant concept and Isaac was  able to tell us a lot about the history of the place and the ethical/sustainable sourcing of their ingredients. On the second time we were there, he was with a trainee, who was almost as friendly and knowledgeable. While Isaac is officially our favorite, I have no doubt this place hires only the best of the best in order to provide quality, sustainable, delicious food with top-notch friendliness and service.

B-vI9fMkkfq5Qa9oQHWNHQ.text: With so many good restaurants in Phoenix, it's not easy to find a bad one.  Lucky for my wife and I, Breadfruit was up to the challenge.  Save your time and money, there is no Jamaican here - and no breadfruit, beef patties, ackee and salt fish, brown stew chicken, D and G soda or any other staple of the island.  The price point is completely off the wall - and service is pretentious at best and the vibe is hypster with a Bob Marley soundtrack thrown in for good measure....

Xg_PC53B9GEEXLh-nN4EEg.text: Came in from California for a few days and this place was an amazing find. We had three drinks and they were all excellent my favorite was probably the punch which was just all orange bitters, orange juice and rum. Bitbit changes every day so ask first.  Another excellent drink was the Sugarfoot. A little bit sweet but great as a second drink. And then we looked at the other reviews and got the rum old fashioned. Stronger and to the point. Got the baked plantains which come with mango chutney and cinnamon.. Highly recommend them The service was just great. Our server Isaac was friendly and fun to talk with.  Sitting on the front porch with reggae playing softly and  we just started drifting off to the carribean!

HLs6P6IUsK5wFD5lIXZJmA.text: THE BREADFRUIT = 2 stars:  We've dined here four times now.  The quality of the food is all over the place, but usually settles on just being "ok".  Small portions for the price too. I find the service staff to be "uppity", bordering on condescending.  I've always walked away still hungry and unsatisfied.  I won't be dining there again. RUM BAR = 4 stars:  Rum Bar is in a different universe. The bartending staff has always been friendly and helpful. Amazing selection of rums and imaginative cocktails.

PzONNdi7trloxMQtDvEbRQ.text: Get the rum flight! Everything after that won't matter! Very quaint romantic spot with great locally sourced food. Have a good cigar selection. Highly recommended!

T5bvUGVnG3U079fUFdSNWw.text: This is a review of the bar only - I'll review the food another time. The thing is, the bar is the star here. We return to this little gem again and again because the craft cocktails are hands-down, the BEST in Phoenix.  Every drink on the menu is hand crafted with the utmost gourmet style and fresh, house-made, impeccably-sourced ingredients.   The bar staff is faultlessly trained and knowledgeable, not to mention friendly and welcoming. If you're lucky, you'll get to witness a training session; the owner imparts the history of rum from all over the world to his team. He knows every nuance, from how they are made and aged, to how to pair them in ways your palate has never experienced.   It's a flavor adventure no matter what you order, but try the Rum Old Fashioned. It's the best we've ever had. Honorable mention to the pina colada; it's absolutely outstanding... not too sweet like most others you've had, and the real coconut, both in the mix, and as a garnish, makes it transcendent.   On a cool evening, try the from-scratch hot buttered rum. It's so rich, luscious and complex, you'll be transported to an island paradise.

huHRjhqfkMiCqZVZT40qNA.text: The food at Breadfruit takes you to the island. The Jerk Pork and Polenta was delicious. My wife enjoyed the Mussel and Shrimp Stew. My Hemingway Daquiri complimented the meal. The service is excellent.  What's wrong? The place is dark from the street and somewhat hard to find. Tired of the Phoenix staples of Italian and Mexican? Then you should try this place.

ltulpZey03elOzOxSNoREA.text: First time visit after reading the reviews. I was shocked at the service we received after reading some of the negative reviews on slow/bad service. Those reviews couldn't have been further from the truth. We experienced incredibly amazing service. EVERYONE was attentive and pitched in to make sure empty plates were removed in a timely manner, water glasses were filled appropriately. Margaret our server was very sweet, attentive, professional, unobtrusive but made sure we had everything we needed and oh, was she ever so familiar with all the dishes and cocktails offered and offered in depth and spot on descriptors to everything we asked her about. Unfortunately, we found out it was her last night. Sad to see her leave :( The food was amazing. Delicious, well presented, with just the right amount of heat to make you feel you were in Jamaica and the music added to the ambiance. We got to meet Dwayne and Chef Danielle and extended our appreciation and thanks for a memorable dining experience. The only drawback is because they are in the downtown area, parking is not very convenient. Other than that, 2 thumbs up for sure. We will definitely be back!!!

6vxF-SV0LsZ1Hl2MPFbqVA.text: I made reservations here for my birthday for a party of 6 on a Monday for the patio. My party and I show up and the host seems like he can barely force a smile out. He indicates our table is set up inside to which I reply I had made a reservation for the patio. I am still incredulous at his response when he says that can't be accommodated because they didn't know. This is their oversight and not even the slightest notion to correct this! All the meanwhile, the patio (and restaurant in general) have a total of 2 tables!!! Wow.   My friends can see I am a bit shocked and bummed so they chime in that it is my birthday and can't something be done to accommodate us on this special occasion? Nope. Literally got a sneer from the host in response. So our only option is to accept this table inside where the smell of old seafood seems to linger. Oh and I forgot to mention that we were missing one person so our party couldn't be seated right away. Remember, there are only 2 other tables occupied and NO wait!! Again, wow.  So we sidle up to the empty bar to wait and the bartender who actually seems very friendly offers us the drink special for the evening. One of my friends asks to sample this and our bartender extremely hesitantly pours her a sip. I do not blame him for this hesitation since I am sure management influenced this with the less than accommodating environment they foster. At this point, we haven't even been sat and it is a dining experience from my worst dreams, albeit on the day I want to celebrate with my close friends. I call it a wrap and we bounce out of there and celebrate at Cibo instead.   Give me a break Breadfruit. Not even Michelin star restaurants feel like they have the posterity to treat their customers this way. I will not return and will certainly discourage people from dining at your establishment.

cANiU5ITN-qCsTX7L9xPVQ.text: Went to the rum bar this weekend for the first time and absolutely loved it. The bartenders take their job seriously, after all, this is a rum-themed bar. Our bartender explained the different cocktails on the menu, which were separated by course, with a whole section dedicated to classics like mojitos and daiquiris.  I ordered the Kingston 5 and the Velvet and Vinyl. The first drink made me feel like I was on a beach somewhere in the Carribean. The second drink had many layers to it, and I could taste distinct flavor of hibiscus in the thick drink. Both drinks used the finest rum I've ever tasted. I even told my husband, "Man, we need to stop buying cheap rum and buy the good stuff!" That's how much of a difference it made. We could've stopped at cocktails but ended up ordering two small plates, the scallops and the shrimp. Both plates tasted absolutely delicious, but will say they were definitely on the smaller portion side, especially for the price. Overall can't wait to come back here for another Date Night!

aGzhIGOMBG2qzBwuXyvRTQ.text: Love the drinks. You can't find in your typical bars. Unique, aromatic, full of flavor and you get money worth. Highly recommend. I had the Tamarind, delish.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LW7Z2iuE8FklLvMZrxQGVQ.text: Aruba, Jamaica, ooh I wanna take ya.. Bermuda, Bahama   If you want any type of rum from any of the above, cmon on pretty mama.. You DON'T have to go to Kokomo.. BUT, if you or you're AmX is really pretty, there is a 50 year old Appleton Estate Rum for $2500 per. Now, if your pocket book isn't feeling oh-so Hemingway, The Breadfruit claims to have the most extensive Rum menu in all of Arizona.. and after seeing it for myself, I happen to believe this claim. The drinks here are all worthy starting as described by our attentive waiter as 'fruit forward' to more 'heavy and serious' and after dinner as the drink menu follows on. The bartenders at The Breadfruit have a romance with rum, which is regarded as the most versatile spirit. There is a Rum Punch of the day. The evening we were there, it was a light, fruity, rum concoction of hibiscus and roasted smoked pineapple. The punch carried PUNCH. Do not come expecting a full wine list here, as there are only two from Southern Arizona. This is a Rum Bar. Be prepared to take an Uber. :-) The next drink I had for dinner, in lieu of wine, was a Velvet and Vinyl. This drink was almost too pretty to drink! The waiter delivered this deep pink to red libation to my table in a beautiful little glass, don't be fooled by its beauty. On first sip, I decided to do just that: sip it. The Velvet and Vinyl is a beauty of Appleton Estate VX Rum, hibiscus liquor, (which is house made!), ginger, pineapple, lime, bitters and a touch of rose mist. If you are the DD on your night here, don't worry, there are nice libations that carry sans alcohol for you too!   Key Largo, baby why don't we go to Kokomo?   Speaking of Kokomo. If you have ever been in the Florida Keys and had a corn fritter than you will appreciate some of Breadfruits appetizers. We noshed on the delicious Salt Fish Fritter. It was a flat fritter of cod fish served with a creme fraiche of dill and coconut. There are two served warm on a plate and a good way to offset some of that rum before dinner.   Montego.. why don't we go, Jamaica.   Jamaican Jerk..  The Breadfruit and Rum Bar has that too. For dinner, I had the Jerk Pork and Polenta: a slowly smoked pork shoulder that had been marinated in rum, (what else?), jerk rub and smoked over pimento woods and served over tasty warm polenta and seasonal farm vegetables. The pork is more of a pulled type dish over the polenta. My date, my husband, also wanted to relive our vacation to the Caribbean with some tastes of jerk and rum and opted for the Pimento Wood Jerk Chicken, which was a HUGE serving of game hen smoked over pimento wood, rubbed with house jerk rub and served over rice and small peas. This dish had some spice to it! It comes as a hen on a bone and was amazing! The table of us being 6 had various plates that included the Blue Mountain Curried Goat over Basmati Rice and it was said to be yummy and tender and looked like a generous portion. The Guava Glazed Pork Belly was also ordered on our table and there were about 5-6 slices of the Pork Belly two being super fatty with not much meat, which can happen with pork belly and one reason, I personally don't order it. Our friends ordered a dessert to share and for $9 it was a super small ramekin of dessert which is a little on the pricey side to me. Whereas, I felt the rest of the menu was on point for pricing. The menu is ever changing and uses local farms and sources such as Mayas Farms, 2 Wash Ranch, Pillsbury Wines and The Meat Shop , JUST to name a few.   A couple of things to know. The Breadfruit and Rum Bar is small. Make a reservation if you are having dinner. We had a party of 6 for our monthly little dinner club and were asked to secure with a credit card. They will confirm on the day of the reservation and I like that. There was a mix up with our reservation when we arrived despite the confirmation via telephone earlier in the day for what was to be a half and hour later than was logged into the reservation system when we arrived, SO I am glad we decided to arrive early for a drink! There was also some confusion over wanting a drink at the bar and the girl wanting to take us out to the cigar area patio out back. It all worked out and I didn't care either way because we ended up loving our waiter who carried us through the first drink to the last drink after our dinner was served. Parking is somewhat a bear in this area, also. Allow time for that! The patio, should you want to sit out there for the Cigar and Rum Manifest, ( a separate menu all its own!), has patio heaters for the winter and is expansive.   Our service , (from order to getting entrees) , was slow but my husband and I don't mind that after having lived in France and knowing that food is what makes social times the best ! The wait staff made up for the slowness ten fold anyway.   Everybody knows a little place like Kokomo...  (Well, at least if you order that Appleton Estate Vintage, you will :) ) ...

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cigar ?! Yeah mon.
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The cute patio out back...
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rum Punch of the Day !

5HXakqDS5y3fTTCSYv6Oww.text: There's a Lost Generation vibe here. The lights are low lit, the crowd is sparse but filled with characters, and the drinks are above top shelf. Ernest Hemingway wrote his novels here.  Before the sun rises, this is the place to visit if you're over the "younger" scene. You'll probably come to some type of epiphany if you go here alone.   This place specializes in a variety of different rums. I never liked rum before this place cause I got the grocery store I'm on a budget version. I get why Captain Jack Sparrow is asking why it's gone. It's just that good.  So hit this place up. If you don't have chest hair, you will grow some. If you don't grow chest hair, you will grow something afterwards, so go to find out what.

VigHbz9ALSqn0e4FSPQHnQ.text: The drinks were great.....but very expensive....was very disappointed with three out of four meals...the food is really not that great....jerk chicken/game hen was not very flavorable, nor was the jerk pork...the small plate of pepper shrimp was  good.. be prepared to spend a lot if you want more than one drink

RcEy4N8SfDB8iqoAmIj7oQ.text: Well.  Got to say I'm not much of a rum drinker..  but this is a place to eat.  That too.... drink. Wife and I came here as a farewell dinner before we return home from visiting AZ.  You got to get the house rum drinks... Nice with pleasant taste and smooth.   If weather is nice.. eat outside to enjoy good food and nice Caribbean music.   Also, splendid service by the staff .

r0TZbAlmMWnrzPL-KF5Z4A.text: Went to this place for the first time on a recommendation from a work colleague. I had the whole black bass and it was excellent. The rum drinks were also great!   I was in Phoenix for a week. Best meal I had this trip.   This place is walking distance from all the big hotels in downtown Phoenix in a safe neighborhood. No taxis needed.

YbvbasFB_2b5pBAlgMRQYw.text: This is my very favorite little spot in Phoenix. My first visit, the daily rum punch was blood oranges, passion fruit, and rum infused with baby grapefruit leaves!! Are you kidding?? It was AWESOME, and just a small example of the 'up and beyond' level of passion invested in everything they do! True! The daily punch, and the seared scallops with rum reduction, hot buttered rum, and plantains are simply must haves, and regardless of your other selections, you will find yourself saying OMG to everything you put into your mouth!! Breadfruit is a little jewel, and exactly that "hole in the wall" kind of place with incredible food we search high and low for! Enjoy

S-m7yJLfUMI6MDx5KvWDbQ.text: Food was great. We had the jerk chicken, pork and polenta, and lamb. Everything was very good except for service. Bartenders were short and rude and not very welcoming. Server was very unpleasant and seemed very unhappy and impatient. We will not be back.

eujPNtXbE_Bgq6wWW9p5YA.text: Appetizers, overpriced, small portions.   Entrees, good flavor... Service... lacking.  The server who had our table was awkward... She was nice enough, but didn't really understand service.  My friend asked for a cocktail twice, and on the first occasion, they said they couldnt make anything with grapefruit juice... and on the second occasion, He ordered a pina colada and specified a type of rum.  She came back and said the bartender wouldnt make it because the flavor would comprimise the integrity of the flavor.... He wanted brazilian rum in a pina colada, Big deal, just make the drink, don't make him feel bad.  we felt rushed as our plates were cleared before our friends were finished eating...  The food was tasty, however I won't be back due to the strange vibe I got.

2JxUq_DiA0i2s1-qCAXi8w.text: I really enjoyed my visit to this restaurant. An upscale Carribean dive that has great location, food, and drinks. What more could you ask for? I had the jerk chicken and the vegetable medley. The jerk chicken was seasoned and cooked to perfection with the right amount of heat. The rum punch was great and the servers were kind. My only complaint would be the pricing compared to the portion size. Not sure if this could be the best option price wise when looking to satisfy your jerk craving, but its will be an option you wouldnt regret.

8YU6Ini7gBX6Eeaf3KkP2g.text: Ahhhh Breadfruit....where do I begin? With your delicious cocktails? Your fun and happenin atmosphere? I wish that's where this review was going, but alas, I left your establishment with a bad taste in my mouth....  Let me begin by saying this was a solid 3 stars (maybe even 3.5?) before I got my bill. The "special fish" sounded great, and after Craig went on and on about how they have their own fish monger, and how the fish is flown in daily, and yadda yadda yadda, how could I resist? The fish was good, the portion was ridiculously small, and the accoutrement were completely forgettable. So riddle me this: How is it, that on a menu where no item is more than 14 bucks (all items very well priced by the way) that the "special fish" is f-ing 25 dollars??? I mean, if you have a special that is more than twice most of the entree's on your menu, you best inform the customer. I was not pleased to receive my bill and discover that little surprise on the check. Seriously, had the fish been priced closer to the rest of the entree's, the anger I am spewing currently would be much less vitriolic.   Additionally, the accoutrement: grilled pineapple (ok, I get it, it's sweet), deep fried bread (WTF? you could lash these bastards together and float back to Jamaica on 'em), and coleslaw that is obviously meant as a garnish and not to be eaten. Give me a freakin break.   The red beans and rice were whatever, my wife's jerk chicken was dry and NEEDED that chutney to be at all edible, and the meal itself was completely forgettable. Tack on the not-so-great souffle that Craig talked us into, and the more I've thought about my dining experience at Breadfruit, the more pissed off I am I'm 80 bucks lighter (2 entrees, 2 drinks, desert, and tip). Sure, sure, it was my fault for ordering all that, but c'mon man, I mean, really?   I will return to this fun and drinkably tasty locale again for perhaps appetizers and drinks (most definitely the drinks) and the atmosphere when I'm in the downtown area, but I will here-for-to pass on further dining experiences.

UP45yZnK6t5T30xn9CmzZg.text: The portions were small.  Cooked scallops were cold.  Jerked chicken salad barely had any chicken in it.  Large plates were brought with tiny servings.  Food was tasty enough but insultingly small portions.  My bill was high relative to what I received.  Wouldn't go back.

f8G5kT-ZqSzvtMqRyy0cXw.text: This place was amazing!  My friends and I started a dinner club and this was the pick for our inaugural meeting.  (I will refer to my friends as J and S.)    We sat outside on the patio and I recommend that if you visit when it's not too hot.  I ordered the Tofu Curry with Jasmine Rice and Plantain.  It was amazing! I usually don't like coconut curry but this was very good.  I will definitely order it again.  J ordered the Jerk Shrimp with pineapple, corn and breadstick.  We had read that the jerk seasoning is very hot and we were warned!  Inferno is a good way to describe it.  I LOVE hot food so I didn't mind it at all when I tried it. J paired the shrimp with the pineapple and found that it toned down the spicy to a manageable level and was a "delightful combination".  I tried a bit of the breadstick and it was a sweet bread which was great to balance out the spiciness of the jerk shrimp.  S ordered the Molasses chicken lollipops with red potatoes.  When her order arrived we all agreed that "lollipops" was an excellent description because the dish looked exactly like we expected.  I asked S for her opinion and she said "the meat was good and the molasses added a nice sweet flavor that went with the name lollipop but was borderline overpowering. The potatoes were good as were the vegetables but I could have used more than 3 veggies on the plate."    We all ordered the rum punch which is different every time.  This night it was a raspberry pink blend.  I enjoyed it so much I had two!  We were warned that the portion sizes are smaller than other places.  The prices are higher than other places in the area but I believe that you get what you pay for.  I think that the quality of the food justified the prices.    Our waitress Margaret hit the sweet spot between being attentive without hovering.  She was very knowledgeable about the menu and gave good recommendations.

gaXCKkKCewo80TC_wjNQ9Q.text: I really love this place. The craft cocktails are all wonderful, it's hard to hold yourself back when you want to try them all. As the name implies, they only serve rum based drinks, but the amount of thought that goes into every ingredient they add really makes them all shine. Speaking of rum, if you're used to Malibu, captain Morgan's, and Bacardi, you're going to be surprised that there's a whole other world of amazing rums not like anything you find in a typical grocery store. If you don't like rum you haven't been to rum bar. The food is also really tasty. Most of it is pretty carb heavy but I'll break my diet to come here. The jerk chicken is spicy and flavorful, and if you're looking to splurge the lobster is excellent. I try to come here at least once a week.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flight to haiti

5qeiUAFup0R65fv_gzXlFw.text: They have some of the best cocktails in town. Ask for Bryan the bar manager and he'll pick your poison. Some of the best drinks I've ever had. More rum than you could ever imagine :)

cHivnjcWVZBRe-Q6GZVhnA.text: My husband (Jamaican) and I were very excited to try the Breadfruit, especially after reading so many rave reviews. Sadly the best part of our experience and meal was the drink which turns this review into a 2-star instead of 1.   Even with a half-empty dining room at 8pm on a weekday, we were told they did not have a table available and had to wait half an hour, at which point we were escorted into the now near-empty dining room.   Our appetizers and entrees were bland, with only hints of Jamaican flavors, and served luke-warm.  Hubby had a upset stomach and touch of queasiness a couple hours after dinner.   The concept of the restaurant is great but I recommend anyone visiting The Breadfruit should go for happy hour and get the rum punch or other tasty cocktails and skip the food - then you might not be disappointed.  :-)

aUqN4R7FBsIQnl4rvBeTEA.text: I don't even like rum, but the drinks were amazing. The food was also amazing. Finishing the night with hot buttered rum and a cigar on the back patio was perfection. Made it 2 hot buttered rums.   Just go there!!

kRPiOi1T03P5s7ZhGIHsJg.text: First Friday for July (7/1/2011): This place is PACKED! Think of a sardine can. Packed. Little room to walk around from bar to seat and no room to breathe. (As soon as Breadfruit has the money, they need to expand the space! Good drinks are a total loss in such a tiny space.) Oh, and you cannot take your drink outside and sit at the cafe table-- I do not think their liquor license allows that. (Minus one star for the cramped space.)  The drinks are fantastic! They are strong, flavorful, bold drinks. Your heart may skip a beat at the prices (the rum drinks are all $8-9, the beer is $4-5.50, and the wine is $8-12/glass), but the drink is worth the money. My one (1) mojito vanilla made me intoxicated. Yes, I am a light weight, but I usually need 2-3 drinks to do the trick. (Seriously, five star drinks)   The mojitos are fan-tas-tic. Wonderful. Delicious. The Matuselum Platino rum used in the mojitos is smooth and tasty. The muddled mint is powerful, but it does not overpower the drink. It is a perfect balance.   My review should honestly be two lines: 1)Good, strong, delicious, pricey drinks that you should enjoy; and 2) tiny, cramped space not good for large parties or too many patrons.

Duf_rAOGb9INYzsYIlLwJg.text: Amazing!  Great drinks and food.  I really like the jerk chicken and the Spanish gentleman cocktail.  But know that the chicken is very hot.

vssv5gUY_ZT8qt9LDwBbkw.text: Three years ago I received the worst service of my life. I agree with one of the previous reviewers who stated that the waiters were very pushy. My waiter acted very pretentious as he recommended every expensive dish on the menu. He seemed disappointed when we did not order expensive drinks and food. I ordered the jerk chicken which was semi decent but over priced. I did not order the chef's special. Later my waiter brought the special by our table and basically said that we should have ordered the special. He proceeded to walk away without making eye contact. I felt like I was being harassed by him. My girlfriend ordered the curry tofu plate. Her vegetables were burnt and her tofu looked like gruel. All in all I would recommend that people go anywhere else in Phoenix. Microwave meals in your own home would be a better option. I wish I could give this place a negative star rating. F- for service and a D for food.  Yeah just do not ever go here!!!! Stay away!!!!!

-a4RteFXCyLGGG5xiIr90A.text: If you like fresh locally grown with just the right mix of flavors, here's another favorite of mine.  It just keeps getting better each time I go.  This well respected establishment takes pride and genuinely cares about the food they are serving.    -Curried Tofu  -Scallops  -Patties (tilapia)  -Brown Stew Chicken  -Carrot juice" it's addicting  The Breadfruit focuses on Caribbean dishes in Phoenix, using locally grown, fresh organic produce.  The restaurant itself is small, but they've expanded by adding a Rum bar.  Everything is freshly squeezed and they have the drink of the day.  For the after dinner cigar smokers, there is a cigar bar where you can enjoy your cocktail and smoke your cigar.  The owner's of this establishment are very friendly and it's almost as if you are dining at their own home.  Everything is cooked to order so you can enjoy a great experience.  Chef Danielle was just in the AZ Republic as one of the top Chef's in Arizona!

3JnXLNqUzyIGVgLhqx7OrA.text: Cocktails were very good! Food was also good, however plates were small for the prices. Overall, loved it. Sitting at the bar is the best spot.

95nH8UpSDanPztkLWCtWDw.text: Ok, I was a bit harsh last time (to be fair, that salad was really something awful). I have been back once for just appetizers and again last night for a dinner date with the BF. Both times have been Fan - Tastic!!! Last night we started with the scallops and a couple of drinks. The scallops were amazing. Spicy and perfectly cooked. The portion is a bit small, though, for the price (2 big scallops for 12$). I ordered the pork belly and it was tender and delicious. It came on top of a white bean mash with a sweet and spicy sauce. SO Good!!! The BF got the jerk pork with polenta. OH Em Gee.... I could eat that everyday (but I wouldn't...of course.... *looks around*). It was spicy...spicy enough to make my nose run a little. It was flavorful...smoky, spicy, and savory. The polenta was the perfect side to go with the meat too. *droooool* For dessert we had the chocolate and orange souffle.... The souffle was very good...molten and delicious chocolate with just enough orange flavor...but the thing that made it...rum whipped cream. Yes, you read it right....RUM whipped cream!!! It was perfect with the souffle and just such a good idea overall. Yes, it is expensive, but I had a fabulous time there, it is cute and intimate, and the food is awesome. The service is great, attentive, but not too attentive. I will definitely be back.  PS be sure to make reservations...this place is tiny and gets booked up.

czNvyE0I2dKlEtRqoN7Ldg.text: INCREDIBLE food and rum.  I can not  express what a lovely experience we had for apps and outrageously delicious drinks.  Wish I lived in Phoenix.

jLR1PUMMGYheM46dOWCi8Q.text: Enjoyed the bar area and the drinks. The food was good however I was disappointed in the portion sizes. Also, I thought there was a limited variety in the menu.

rhstMh4ERZ2NZbbnvdkaoQ.text: This place was amazing - great staff. We have scallops as an app and then prawns for meal - both were amazing.

MTz-7tIMmIDNjsShH0o9Eg.text: Tuesday night party of four. Service was amazing and drinks were on point. Waiter knew every detail of the menu and we took his recommendations.  3/4 of us order the jerk pork. OMG it was the best jerk pork and polenta we've had. We were worried about having Jamaican food in Phoenix but this placed killed it.   Excited to go back and see what the weekend vibe is like at rum bar. Overall highly recommend for out of towners great atmosphere great location!

w0F4Vh2uR_wOES-Lh6dZuw.text: I found this restaurant on "Vegan Restaurant Locator" so I had expectations of many things to select from as was described on the site.  In reality there was one entree on the menu...or you could put together some sides to keep it vegan.  It's a nice place but they probably shouldn't be listed on a vegetarian/vegan friendly website.  The description there is misleading.  That being said, the food was excellent and the atmosphere charming.  It's a little upscale so we felt a bit uncomfortable in our t-shirts and jeans and the look on the host's face confirmed it.  If we go again we will dress a bit nicer and will know what to expect on the menu.

r40pAQBZwyo-jO6GBu64LQ.text: Their rum bar has now been open a while and flights are available.  I was never a rum aficionado - too many rum n cokes when I was too young to care about such things - and have now discovered a whole new world.  The food has become nothing short of spectacular.    The ambiance - from the inside I can pretend I'm in the West Village circa 1975 by Greenwich and Horatio.  Doesn't get any better than that.

UODnHHL5LUM7eusFLEHZvQ.text: A bit pricey, but the curry veggie was good and the mixed rum punch cocktail was so yummy! Definitely would come back. Bf and his cousin enjoyed their food very much and said the salmon was delicious.

nENXGTaSQf3iMY7sAwrZMw.text: If you like rude slow service and dry mediocre over priced food - then this is your place! So much potential, great location and cute restaurant but the food and service needs help. PS - Not kid friendly

6Xxjwst3yNlzYWIqttxzPQ.text: Amazing cocktail program!  You can tell they have been doing if for a long time, not just because it's now a trend. Food was awesome and very intensely seasoned. Cute ambiance. Really felt like I was out of Phoenix. The whole experience made me feel like I was in the Caribbean.

NGvyLE8ITL35edfII3SsXw.text: Every aspect of dining is worth the cost. The service, food, and ambiance are all wonderful. My favorites include the jerked scallops with sauteed veggies and the mussels. I also love the carrot juice and the coffee! The Breadfruit is a great place for special occasions.

cZ_3k8p_K8iszE5yTvFN4w.text: Just sipping a snake preview from the spring cocktail lineup: French Marmalade. Wow it is sensational! And after trying Gin Rummy and Jolly Roger I'm trying to decide which one I like best. Tough choice :-) They are all great - my vote tonight... French Marmalade. For appetiser snacks we had Plantain Avocado spring rolls - baked in a wanton wrap and served with mango salsa. Great pairing. I'm glad to be back in Phoenix :-)

AMO5w2KjD91XEbdU3N0JNQ.text: The scallops were delicious - mojitos perfection! Our service was excellent and we were quite pleased with our experience. My only gripe is that they try to squeeze too many people in a very small space and they should let people know they have a dress code. This is Arizona and your in the middle of downtown Phoenix with a large college population. However I like the idea of getting dressed for dinner, personally. But to be told that one of my dinner guests couldnt sit in the dining area cause he was wearing a tank top...a little off putting. Since we had been sitting there waiting for a table and had made reservations. That info coulda been given.

b9C-qDPykqrLpLkblJfZoQ.text: We love this place. Every time has been awesome.  The food, the drinks, the service! Just great! GO!!

CcGttjrD9SQbXnKJdajgKg.text: I'm glad I got to try Jamaican food but I won't go back.  I am impressed that the restaurant uses almost all organic stuff and buys as much locally as possible.  They are located just a block from Phx Public market after all.  I ordered the carrot juice drink that came highly recommended by the waitress.  It was just okay.  I really love Trader Joes carrot juice and would choose that over this restaurants and it is much cheaper. As an appetizer.  MY friend and I shared the plantain/avocado eggrolls.  I couldn't wait to try them.  I love avocado and they sounded amazing.  For the price ($7.50, I think) you only get two eggrolls cut in half.  I thought that was a bit pricey.  They were a huge disappointment.. Plantains are a bit mushy and bland as a rule and so are avocados.  So together you got a bland, mushy eggroll wrapped in a flavorless wonton wrapping.  It came with a mango puress dipping sauce which was sweet but not very flavorful and mushy.  lol  For dinner I had the coconut curry tofu.  The tofu had a texture I have never experienced before and at first I didn't like it but it really grew on me.  The rice was blah, the coconut steamed vegetables was boring from how they sound and the fried plantain was good.  The restaurant is cute though and the service really good.

79zDWMx3twObjdDP9xvzIw.text: Amazing food and cocktails. The music is to die for, if you are a reggae fan like me. A perfect meal!

mZPZtDVy_OK5R0BcMogD3w.text: The owner was great! He let us sit at the bar (asking patrons to move to make room for the four of us) without a reservation. Once we sat the bartender helped us to choose drinks and food. Hands down some of the best Jamaican food I have eaten. The owner even suggested a great pairing for my escavitch fish, the daiquiri agricole was strong and an excellent pair to the spicy fish!   This place was so good we recommended it to other friends who went later that night, but because it was late they had already run out of some of their menu items. So I might suggest getting an earlier reservation so you get a chance to try the plantains and the fresh food! Go early...this place is small and fills fast!

Xk1CmWMTnbPqt_hw1PtMmQ.text: its a nice place. the rum bar makes an 'ol fashioned' (with rum) that i had never had. it was pretty good... cant really say the same about the food though. it was 'ok'. im jamaican expected better. the portions were very small for the price. i'll probably go back and try it 1 more time... or at least for drinks.  *kanye shrug*

0zFli8T0c2jY2Ku96mDesw.text: I have been to the Breadfruit a couple times...I've always enjoyed it. I was sadly a little turned off this last time because of our server. We ate on the rum bar side & he was the bartender...and I have just never dealt with a more pushy waiter. He basically forced my friend to order their drink special, and then would not stop talking about the scallops...I seriously thought he was just going to order them for us. It really took me aback. Don't push so hard dude...  We split the Plantain and Avocado Spring Rolls - AWESOME. We both decided on the Jerk Shrimp salad, which was also really great. I've had their chicken, fish and those damn scallops...and they were all good. All drinks are based with rum, so if you like rum...uh, duh.  I think my favorite thing there is their French press coffee served with a little coconut milk...you barely need it! Their fresh carrot juice is delicious too, believe me.   I guess overall, a nice place to grab drinks or dinner if you're in downtown Phoenix...just, please Breadfruit, LAY OFF. If I don't want something, I don't want it. Don't try to talk to me about it for 15 more minutes to convince me. I think keeping your customers is more important than one up-sell.

C0CNag-bps-1kjYFxIledA.text: A really cut place with a lot of charm. I loved all the different rum drinks they had. We loved the appetizers and  we had the chix and the scallops and the food is always top notch .  The waiter was very attentive and helpful in ordering the different drinks . I will definetly go back.

W1u5KXgmyx9EcYLwRvSQ9w.text: I CAN'T FEEL MY TONGUE.  I didn't know that jerk chicken translated to spice with a little chicken on the side.  I admit that I have sensitive taste buds when it comes to spicy food, but this stuff was way off my spicy-food odometer.  I would say it was flavorful, but my tastebuds were so numb after the chicken, I couldn't tell.  However, I did enjoy everything else!  The bread that comes with your meal is a "festival" on the menu, but it's darn good... and perhaps the thing to save you should the jerk chicken be too much.  I ordered the shrimps on the side of my jerk chicken, but I think I just got trigger happy.  One dish and and appetizer is already plenty, so if the waitress suggests a side of shrimp, I say pass.  Definitely get the plaintain avocado spring rolls.  Interesting texture and taste, plus the mango salsa on the side is quite refreshing.  Speaking of refreshing, I highly recommend the Sorrel to drink.  It's a hibiscus tea and rum blend, but you can't even taste the rum!  Mmm, perfect way to beat the Phoenix heat.  Cute little restaurant with brightly colored walls, which is a welcome change from the red, brown and tan buildings outside.  I came here while I was on a business trip, and it's walking distance from all the Downtown hotels!  I wish I had room for dessert, but I was stuffed.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Breadfruit & Rum Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nm6euN9BdmWfddAG99Lx5w.text: Not many Jamaican restaurants around so our group thought it sounded interesting.  We had a reservation for 7:00 p.m. on a Saturday night which was confirmed the day before and they told us they were going to place us at the high top table in the bar.  We arrived on time and the restaurant was crowded. We noticed there was another group seated at our table.  We were a little annoyed that we had to wait 20 minutes until this group left and they cleared the table.  There was no apology, no explanation.    My friend who only drinks Vodka was not happy that they only had rum and wine.   The food was alright but no one in the group was raving about any of it, and it was pricey.

u6W9arK5jEL-0Lwu7KhRhA.text: Tasty Jamaican food and delicious fruity drinks, but overpriced for the fare/atmosphere.  Service just ok.  The back patio is really nice, but there are so many wonderful places to eat downtown...I'd skip this one.

7g3IbS2QiHyk03QBjFxh6Q.text: Love the drinks, very refreshing.  Love the food, very fresh and flavorful.  I will definitely go back!  HOWEVER....get rid of the double standard for dress code.  If men can't wear a sleeveless shirt, then neither should the women.  And by the way....this is Arizona and 115 degrees!!

e8z4y4OE7JmpXrLnG3kGjw.text: Went to dinner here with some girlfriends during a weekend reunion in Phoenix. We started off with some delicious rum drinks at the bar while waiting the 20 minutes for a table. I had a great Dark & Stormy.  The coconut curried tofu with rice, ripe plantains, and veggies was fabulous, but there were only a few plantains per plate.  If you wish to converse, it's best not to go on the weekends, when the Rum Bar is busy.  Overall, this is an intimate, great bar and restaurant. The drinks are strong, the decor is wonderful, the food is great, and the serve is prompt.
